They started off paper thin but the movie played it up nicely, the visuals were fun and... I can't believe I'm saying this but Jack Black was actually funny in this!There is a tie in with the original but it's subtle and I liked how the ending was faithful to how the original ended. This was fun movie for the family. it started at ground zero but made you care about the characters and get invested in it as it went on. 8.5 stars and a recommendation from me.

"Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" is actually a welcome surprise from a studio who's had some franchise issues recently. The film works as a semi-sequel, homage, and reboot of the Robin Williams classic, and successfully makes an entertaining adventure featuring wonderful performances from Karen Gillian, Dwayne Johnson, the scene stealing Jack Black, and Kevin Hart (despite the fact he's playing himself). This film is a fun and exciting Jungle adventure that will give you just the right amount of nostalgia while also creating something new and inviting, even if the writing can be standard at times.

I wasn't a fan of the Jumanji movie starring Robin Williams, so how huge were the odds against me liking this remake? Well, I do kinda like it. And I can sum up why in two words: no, not "The Rock" (and certainly not "Kevin Hart," who will forever remain an embarrassment). The two words are "Jack" and "Black"! The main comedic premise of the movie is that all the main characters are now inhabiting bodies kinda the opposite of IRL. So Rock is really a scrawny, nerdy scaredy-cat, Kevin Hart is really a huge high school football hero whose nickname is "The Fridge" (call-back to the late William 'The Refrigerator' Perry), and the always plump and lovable Jack Black "In Real Life" is a blonde high school cheerleader named Bethany. And is he EVER. He's so goofy, it's easy to forget how good an actor he can be (strictly when he chooses to, of course). The best section for me is when Jack-as-cheerleader is giving the nerdy girl, who is now both hot-looking and a total bad-ass, tips to distract a couple of male guards with her "feminine wiles," then the girl promptly forgets all the teachings and realizes she's still no cheerleader herself, but she *IS* one, real certifiable bad-ass! Talk about women's empowerment: the two characters that I just described both have got it going ON! Anyway, the plot's totally absurd, of course, but The Rock manages to channel his inner nerd-dom, and Jack Black rocks the (popular-girl) casbah. 6/10 because, well, why not? 😉

Jumani: Welcome to the Jungle is nothing special. It has some charismatic performances in all of the main characters, although Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart definitely take the cake. But besides some of the natural charisma of the actors, I found most of the jokes to be very hit or miss, the script bland and the special effects weren't even that good. The script is mainly a way to get from point A to point B and the things that happen in the middle are kind of predictable and boring. Also, the movie could have easily been 20 minutes or so shorter. Anyway, it's not terrible, it does have a few good laughs and it kept me relatively entertained for most of it.

Review title: Maybe not the movie movie classic, but enjoyable enough
Review_body: 22 years ago released original Jumanji with Robin Williams wasn't as big success as makers expected. Even it wasn't so big box office magnet it has still become a movie classic. Maybe that is a reason who we were have to wait the sequel so long. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is not exactly a sequel even it start where last movie ended. More it is a original story, not re-filming. Because the original movie is such a classic this could be a catastrophic. It is good to see, that it isn't. Even this is not something big movie history, it is still quite enjoyable adventure movie. Script is quite stupid, but has enough of strengths to hold the story together. It is very solid two hour movie experience and timing is strict enough to to keep you oriented. Great effects combined with good storytelling is satisfying enough. Dwayne Johnson and Jack Black are fun to watch. Well timing action with great effects makes this movie quite enjoyable to watch. It may not be any movie classic, but surely it is fun to watch.

It's a fun movie! But there are moments that take itself too seriously which ironically takes away from the movie. Maybe I went in with the wrong expectation that the movie is just going to be a comedy the entire time, but (ironically) I think it would have done better without any serious moments or life lessons. Everything Kevin Hart says is hilarious! The acting in general is great!

There is only one life, and there are three lives in the game. When the last life is left in the game, will people try to face the difficulties and levels to the final victory or hide in the game and dare not waste their lives? It is very educational. In particular, there is a line that makes me very profound. What kind of efforts do you want to make? The whole drama has a lot of laughter.

Was it needed ? The answer is NO. This one is one of the worst sequel ever made. It is completely useless and never has a single chance to rise. The pace is awful and everything is just odd and without any purpose. Despite the good cast, it is just a waste of time.

Review title: Great work by entire crew and cast!
Review_body: You must see this one in the cinema to trully enjoy all the fun, the effects, the humor etc. This is kind of a movie, that even if it would be streched to 3 hours, people would still watch it! It would give more room for individual charachter development and so on. Well, anyway. Great work! Hart is fantastic. He's the one who offers you quite some laughs. What a fun guy this is! But otheres as well. Pleasantly supprised by this movie. Usually sequels don't go well but Jumanjy 2017 made such an excellent job. Cast is fantastic, could not be better picked. Goes both for adult and young versions of them. Story is well made, not to complicated and humor is funny. Worth your time and money.

Jumanji is a film I grew up with so it'll always hold a place in my heart. It's by no means the greatest film ever made but it is a film I never thought would need a sequel, the very idea being a product of the lazy Hollywood cycle. To do a sequel to Jumanji, you have to be brave enough to evolve the franchise and not just rehash it all, which is exactly what they did with Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle.When four teenagers get sucked into the video game Jumanji, they become their chosen avatars; Dr Smolder Bravestone (Dwayne Johnson), Professor Shelly Oberon (Jack Black), Franklin Finbar (Kevin Hart) and Ruby Roundhouse (Karen Gillan). Together they must play along and finish the game to stand any chance of getting back home.The evolution of Jumanji from board game to video game is one of the sensible ways that the creative team bring us a sequel two decades after the original was released. It's the only way the kids of today would ever play it so to see the game itself change to attract new players makes sense. The idea of a sequel after all this time is one that left me skeptical however, thanks to a changed concept of the story taking place inside the game rather than the game coming to the real world, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle quickly became a sequel to become interested in.The changed concept is one that leads to a good old-fashioned adventure romp full of action and plenty of fun for the entire family. The idea of the kids being sucked into the game and being forced to play it out as characters totally opposite to their everyday selves makes for an amusing watch, the raucous laughter from the audience being a telling sign.No one is having more fun here than the four leads of the film mind. Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Jack Black and Karen Gillan all make Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle such great entertainment; Johnson milking it while playing a nerd trapped inside the body fit for an action movie star, Hart revelling in the big guy trapped in a small guy's body role, Black stealing the film as the Instagram obsessed girl playing as an overweight professor, a role he seems so suited for, and Gillan bringing the fierceness when she needs to as Ruby Roundhouse a.k.a. the "Killer of Men" which, as you've guessed, is so far away from her character back in the real world. You get a sense that working on this set would have been so much fun.Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle works as a continuation of the Jumanji franchise, even if there are people out there who are adamant it won't. It's the perfect kind of film to take the family along to and I can guarantee fun will be had all round. It was much better than I was expecting and I'm ready to call it the biggest surprise of the year.

For Christmas, I received one hundred dollars in PlayStation cards...so I bought some movies. One of them was Jumanji. I can't tell you how much my grandson and I enjoyed this film! It really keeps you on the edge of your seat and special effects are so cool! The acting is great and I loved seeing Jack Black in a movie again...it's been a while. I found nothing wrong in this movie that my 6 year old grandson couldn't watch. It's a movie for all ages and it's great fun to watch I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to see this. Until next time!

Considering it's got two actors I dislike 'in extremis' I certainly did not expect to have so much fun watching it. The four leads had exactly the right tone for the script's humor, which is silly but not stupid. Mostly.
Ever since Dwayne Johnson started his acting/movie star career I was and still am impressed that despite my expectation of 'massive ego' to emanate, he appears to be taking his acting lessons as seriously as he can with little apparent fear of making fun of himself.
Good boy.
Same with Kevin Hart. Lines and delivery were fun.
Karen Gillan is adorable.
For the first time ever, Jack Black overcame my shadenfreuden best wishes for his career.
Bobby Cannavale still has them.

Review title: A really good comedy, action packed movie!!!
Review_body: Jumanji: Welcome to the jungle is a 2017 American fantasy adventure comedy film starring some Hollywood's biggest stars. A brilliant movie to watch with the family very entertaining and will have you laughing out loud all the way through with plenty of action as well. You certainly won't get bored. Brilliant acting from some amazing actors and actresses. The film will keep you hooked no doubt so get your popcorn and drink out and enjoy this movie. I absolutely loved it go watch it

Review title: Lots and Lots and Lots and Lots of Fun!
Review_body: All of the performers are fantastic in this film, and are perfect fits for their roles. The group dynamics are excellent, and they all have hilarious back-and-forths with each other. Some of my favorite moments in the movie are when everyone is simply standing around talking. Dwayne Johnson really shows his comedic talents here. While he does have a few scenes where he gets to show off his action chops, most of his role is comedy-heavy, and he delivers on it. Kevin Hart plays the same character he always plays, and more times than not it annoys me, but for whatever reason here it works. Maybe it's his chemistry with the other actors, but he's hysterical in this movie. I'm not a huge fan of Karen Gillan's character of Nebula in the Guardians of the Galaxy films, so I wasn't sure how she was going to be in this. But she delivers as well. Not only does she nail the action beats (and she has some of the best in the whole movie), but she also has some great comedic moments, comedy that I didn't know she could pull off as well as she did. But the true star of this movie is Jack Black. I thought he was hysterical in the trailer, but I was afraid that the concept of him actually being a teenage girl would get old and annoying quick, but it doesn't. Black is perfect for this role, and nails every comedic moment he's given. They are all fantastic together, and it makes for some great entertainment...

Review title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is okay
Review_body: The story is okay, nothing special. A fantastic cast who all to their best. Plenty of comedy, both hit and miss. Some parts of it were really boring. Most of the time I enjoyed it though.

Review title: I was wrong, this film is much better than you think
Review_body:
I hate it when Hollywood decided to cash in on a beloved title so I did not go into this film with much hope, 
From the opening scene that was more or less a copy and paste from the ending of the original Jumanji it did not sit well with me.Thankfully this Jumanji film took me by surprise as it turned out to not be a reboot or Evan a sequel but a fresh new take on the game.A updated version of Jumanji that now involves it being a video game and not a board game. With a great cast from Karen Gillan to Dwayne the rock Johnson Jumanji is a brilliant fun film that edges on being a family film with some strong language but used in a comedy style.From the start of the game to the end Jumanji welcome to the jungle is a great start to 2018 and to be honest it's a film that was needed after a awful 2017 for films.With supporting cast from Jack black to kevin Hart Jumanji is a successful new take on a beloved title and I'll admit that I was wrong!

Review title: I Don't Know if it's Jumanji, But it's Fun
Review_body: While it has (very) little in common with the original family classic besides name and the clever way it evolves the game into the modern age, this ambitious reimagining works best as a paint-by-numbers adventure. It's distractingly entertaining enough, formulaic with familiar story-telling stepping stones of development but its likable cast and clever use of scenario comedy makes it surprisingly enjoyable.

Jumanji 2 is a hilarious, fun, escapist, adventure movie starring The Rock, Jack Black, and Kevin Hart. Using video game rules, the movie truly brings video game magic to the screen, and subtly pokes fun at the action genre. The Rock is great as usual and has a literally huge presence in the movie. The chemistry among the cast is great, and the Rock proves once again he is the go to guy if Hollywood wants to revitalize a franchise, though he has yet to prove he can fuel an actual franchise by himself. As for Jack Black and Kevin Hart, both provide great comedy to an already comical The Rock. However, Kevin Hart's character is more interesting than Black's and therefore wins the crown for best comical character in the movie. Karen Gillan is stunning, and kicks ass, though she is not given much else to do. The movie has great sweeping shots, and over the top action, but all of this makes the movie plausible, given the premise that the characters are trapped in a game world. Recommended for all to watch

Never seen a film staring "The Rock" before but the Trailer showed promise. What worked for this version of Jumanji was the casting as the chemistry was perfect, it was like its predecessor never existed. Gags a plenty and some good one-liners can't wait for a sequel with the very same ensemble

Review title: The Best of the jumanji sequence .
Review_body: This is a highly entertaining film, I was like wow what a ride! it's a a funny emotional adventurous packed with action all in unison on one movie it also has a profound tenors about life how one should live it you got to decide who you going to be, in addition to that it puts a limelight on inferior prevailed trait in nowadays society which is selfishness how bad it is and how one need the spirit of unity to succeed because one need to be altruistic to pass life's difficulties , I truly enjoyed this movie it emanates positive energy so please go watch this, it will definitely change your mood to the better.

Non stop entertainment! Not only us, but entire movie hall was filled with laughter in most of the dialogues & scenes. Action sequences are also very good. Acting is also too good. It's a full 2 hours power packed movie which won't let you get bored for even a single minute.
Why put Kevin Hart in this movie. What a worthless actor. It would have been good if he was not in it. Scum bag.

Jumanji: Welcome To The Jungle is a fantasy comedy action film released in 2017. 
Tells about four teenagers trapped in the game world, they have to complete the mission so they can return to the real world ... The challenges for the challenges they face, can they complete the mission? 
This film is very entertaining to watch with family, funny, silly and charming ..

Review title: Un unconvincing and not so entertaining sequel
Review_body:
Probably it's because I'm not particularly fond of the original with Robin Williams, but I knew from the first trailer that I wouldn't like this reboot/sequel,
certainly the reviews and the unexpected success at the box office had convinced me to give him a chance, so that in the end I joined the wide audience who decided to go and see it at the cinema, during the holiday season.
Well I must say that the first part was also convincing me of the opposite, with a good start, the pleasant lines, often zany and some of which citationists and referienzal (types of jokes that I prefer), pretty action scenes and functional gags , thanks for the most part to the discreet interpretations of the protagonists.
But all this refers only to a promising first part, let's say the first forty minutes of film, because after them the film begins to collapse like a house of cards on a windy day.
The causes are many but the main ones are a screenplay that with the going of the minutes becomes more and more tired and weak, characters to which you are not attached ever despite the attempts of the actors that between voices, visual expressions over the lines, and frantic and exaggerated stunt, try in every way possible to save the film in vain (apparently for many, however, worked), but at least they make up most of the merits of the film, especially Jack Black.
In addition in the film is missing a real villan, the film tries to characterize two, the island itself with its various challenges, and Van Pelt (interpreted trivially by Bobby Cannavale), but neither is sufficiently developed or exploited as it should , especially the second that ends up being useless to say the least.
Towards the end the film proves to be a continuous repetition of jokes and gags, one similar to the other, but less brilliant, less citationist, less amusing, the same is true for the various sequences of action that follow each other without any connection as if they were simple steps and, if for a video game this is fine, for a film is not so, making it simply not fun, not very engaging but quite boring and repetitive.
Too bad because some good ideas are there but most of them are not developed at all, or superficially developed, so in the end what could be a good comedy action movie that paid homage to the original Jumanji and to the world of videogames in a self-ironic, idiotic (but cleverly) and original way has turned into a flat, tasteless, anonymous and, I repeat, boring Blockbuster.
However, I am glad that most of the audience this new "Jumanji" liked, I hope in a second vision, maybe in Blu Ray and in the original language (here in Italy in the cinema the movies are dubbed in our language), that manages to convince me.

The Rock is fun to watch ( The Rundown , Journey To The Center Of The Earth 2 , Central Intelligence etc ) and so is Kevin Hart ( Get Hard ) but this ain't much of a comedy with zero story , cliched dialogues .
one of the WORST

Dear readers, Jumanji is part of my childhood memories. I love the movie and the Jumanji 2017 movie is really fun, especially the characters and many funny scenes that make me laugh until my popcorn scrambling. Dwayne Johnson can do mimiques of face like a teenager. The plot is ordinary, about to conquer a quest of game, but the adventure is never boring. I appreciate the Director of Casting who can search the faces of all actors similar to the faces of game characters, this is miraculous.The only weakness that I found in Jumanji 2017 movie is that the core story itself: how can people get into the game. This is super imaginative and that part also makes us curious about the game business with the question of such: "can we really doing game like in reality?" and if yes, "could we comeback?" The final scene is also quite fiction for me, but I hope Jumanji 2017 movie can be an eternal movie like Home Alone or Air Buddy and every time we watch it, never boring.

Review title: Even my kid hated this Movie.
Review_body:
Horrible experience for kids watching Part 2 of this sequel.. 
Complete waste.. (even kids hated and got bored)Ever since the trailer was released for Jumanji 2.
I always told kids, how much fun I had watching the same.. 
They all watched Jumanji 1 on local DTH (Star, Zee, etc. both Hindi/English) and waited and where very very disappointed. !!It was waste of time/money as kids walked away before half from theatre to get entertained on long drive.. !!!!

I was never a fan of Jumanji and I never understood why people loved it so much. This movie is miles better than the original but it's still a mix between being average and just plain bad. All humour comes from dick jokes and screaming and swearing and whilst it does get some decent chuckles from the NPC interactions it isn't enough to carry a comedy/adventure movie. Also, it's way too cheesy. I don't go to see a movie rated PG 12 for cheesy heartfelt lessons. Lessons in movies shouldn't be taught like this. Why not make it endearing instead of forced? Is it really that hard? Disney has been able to pull off endearing and meaningful messages for decades so why has no one been able to master it yet? The only actor I could tolerate was Dwayne Johnson as he seemed to actually pull off a decent performance instead of just screaming and being obnoxious like Kevin Hart in this movie. I couldn't STAND any other character/actor here. Over all this movie is stupid. It's decent fun for teenagers or fans of Jumanji but I couldn't stand it. Absolutely obnoxious.

This movie has an amazing cast which makes for an amazing movie. I really enjoyed the plot of the movie and how they modernized the Jumanji game as I think it works really well. Add to that there is so many laugh out loud moments that makes for a solid entry in the Jumanji universe.

This is good old fashion entertainment, light hearted and funny. Just immerse yourself in this movie and enjoy, it is a great watch. Very clever filming, it is so like a video game in the way it is acted out. This is just a really good film.

Impressed by the cast, I bought the DVD brand-new without knowing it was a kids' adventure tale inspired by a video game.
Oh well.
The action is okay but the film involves CGI monsters which lose me as a fan and it was squarely aimed at a different demographic.
Definitely okay if you have 6-12 year old kids to show it to.
One of the best comedies i have ever seen in my life, must see if you like to laugh a lot :)

Never seen the original, but I love the sequel!
Four teenagers in detention stumble across a video game called Jumanji and decide to play it. Upon starting the game, they are sucked in and discover that the only way to get back to the real world is by finishing the game.
A brilliantly written, well-executed movie. When I watched this, some of it reminded me of Raiders of the Lost Ark and it turns out that it was directed by the son of the guy who wrote the screenplay for Raiders! And he does an excellent, excellent job.
Dwayne Johnson is so darn hilarious in this movie! He is playing a scared-of-everything, ill-confident, awkward teenager stuck in a muscly action hero/leader avatar and he does it sooo well! The character is so polar opposite to every other role I've seen Johnson in that I wouldn't have believed that Johnson could do it if I didn't watch it for myself. He is utterly convinces you that he really is a skinny awkward teenager stuck in a handsome muscular avatar (no, I don't have a crush of him). The role is both for and against Johnson. I was laughing so much watching Johnson in this role. He's the only one who could do his character as well as he does.
Everyone does their roles really, really well and really fit their characters. It's funny, full of action, and close shaves.
Love it and am looking forward to the sequel.

Review title: Packed full of stereotypes and paint by numbers script
Review_body: We're living in a era of directors and studio execs who saw films twenty years ago and are now in the positions to remake them with their own spin. If you're going to base a film on a classic, then don't just cherry pick the bits you like and throw the rest away!The clever bit about the original - and Chris Van Allsburgs other board game based film; Zathura - was that the action took place in the real world, and how the game would interact with the players actual lives; stampede down main street, big game hunter chasing you, monsoon in the hall. Here, as technology has evolved, so the action takes place inside a computer, yet the game play itself seems to have devolved as the graphics have improved. The NPC's (Non-Player Characters) are supposedly just programmed to interact with the players in a certain way, no matter what they do. The evil game hunter Van Pelt of the original film has been replaced with a two dimensional Professor Russell Van Pelt, who has been given so much power in the game, it would seem unlikely they could survive if he had the same intelligence as his namesake.It's lucky then that the film is more about the relationships between the main characters than actual peril. Alex Wolff/Dwayne Johnson is Spencer, a stereotypical nerd, who plays video games, is awkward around people and rarely gets into trouble. Ser'Darius Blain/Kevin Hart is Fridge; six foot tall footballer, who needs his friend - despite having been pushing him away - of seven years to do his homework so he can keep on playing. Morgan Turner/Karen Gillan is Martha; a smart but shy wallflower with a self image issue. And Madison Iseman/Jack Black is Bethany; a socially obsessed, shallow girl, who can't live without her phone. And in the game, they basically have to face their insecurities; the nerd becomes confident (and strong), the jock becomes smart (and weak), the wall flower becomes an extrovert and the popular girl becomes Jack Black!This last one is a role Black was born to play; a woman trapped in a mans body. Able to play it as effeminately as he wants, make lots of penis jokes and be self-deprecating about his appearance. You knew that as soon as Bethany was out the game she'd make a comment about how glad she was to be in her body.Just like Fridge moans about being the diminutive Hart, Spencer admiring his muscles and Martha questioning her wardrobe choices. All things you'd question if you found yourself in a polar opposite situation and had to adapt.The CGI and film locations are - as expected in the modern era - great, though this seems wrong, given the rudimentary level of the NPC's. They could have had something badly rendered or other throwback to the vintage of the game.It's a good premise, with a strong take away message for the kids, just wish they'd played with the video game premise a little bit more.

I'll keep this one short and sweet. If you're looking for some laughs this holiday season, Jumanji is a must see. The casting was a hit: Hart and Johnson carry over their chemistry from Central Intelligence and they are great together on screen. Jack Black played his role perfectly and Karen Gillan stole the show. She is extremely talented and gorgeous. Gillan was a perfect fit to play ruby roundhouse. 'I was a huge fan of the original and I liked that they chose a different route for this movie. The story felt unique and less predictable. It had some issues, but as a comedy, it is a great movie to see with friends or family and share some laughs. I would see it again. 7/10

Being faithful to the original, I hated the idea of what they did with the concept. I decided to see it with some others because it had rave reviews and I didn't have to pay for my ticket. The action parts were well-done, but what I loved was the comedy. I cried from laughing so hard. The actors, already having great reputations, played their characters to perfection.

This was perhaps the most surprising movie of 2017, especially in terms of box office. The whole idea of a movie poking fun at the tropes, clichés, and stereotypes of video games seems like the type of humor that would get old quickly, and the fact that it came out the week after Last Jedi made it seem like they weren't expecting a financial success. But lo and behold, it won 4 weekends at the box office and grossed $400,000,000 in the U.S alone. Given that popular franchises have been dominating the box office lately, it was nice to see something so original. Granted, it is a sequel, but it doesn't have many connections to the 1995 movie. It really is much more of a standalone work. It immerses itself in its own world and doesn't connect very much to the original Jumanji. It doesn't feel like a sequel to anything.It features the talents of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Kevin Hart, Karen Gillan, and Jack Black. What's so great about these characters are how well they act like the kids who are controlling them. At the beginning, the kids fall into the stereotype zone: the nerd, the jock, the valley girl, and the shy girl. Despite that, the way they interact with each other in their in-game avatars makes up for it and makes them fully fledged characters as opposed to just generic tropes. Most of the humor is stemmed from the idea of someone being in the body and role of someone completely different from them, which is why it works. It's really just classic role-reversal. As for the story, though, it's kind of generic. They need to find this mystical gem and bring it to a jaguar statue before some generic bad guy does. But it's the story isn't really the appeal of this movie, it's about the characters. The jungle looks nice, which is an added bonus.Another thing this movie does very well is how well it represents the video game aspect. You don't need to be a gamer to understand or enjoy this. Anything that general audiences wouldn't understand is simply explained, meaning that anyone can enjoy this. Also, the idea of the NPCs just repeating lines of dialogue to the Rock was very accurate to the idea of a real RPG, making it seem like Jumanji could very well have been a game from back in the day.This is a movie that's on the verge between "guilty pleasure" and "legitimately good." I'd say it's the latter, although it does have elements of the former. It knows exactly what it is and does a very good job at it; it's just a fun comedy about teenagers taking on a new set of roles and forming new bonds as a result. It's fun, it's satisfying, and there's really nothing more to it.

Review title: Surprisingly good and dare I say better than the original...
Review_body: My family and I went to watch this movie because there was nothing else we could see as a family in the theater. The previews did not look appealing to me at all so I wasn't expected much going in. But it turned out to be so much better than I expected after being underwhelmed by movies I had much anticipated to see like Pitch Perfect 3 and even Starwars. My family loved this movie! I grew up with the original and Ioved Robin Williams, but do have to admit I found this one so much funnier, more engaging, and to have a better story line. Just watch it, you won't regret it!

Review title: Not the old Jumanji, but it's still okay
Review_body: This is most definitely not the old movie. The jokes are not as good and a little more predictable. The story doesn't have as much intensity or dark undertone of the original. Backstories about teenage angst replace the sad tragedies of the first movie. The film definitely suffers from comparisons to the original. Taken on it's own it's not spectacular, but it is entertaining, in some ways the movie even comes across as a deconstruction of video games. Worth the watch

Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is directed by Jake Kasdan, written by Chris McKenna and staring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Jack Black and Kevin Hart.Story by Chris McKenna, and it's about four high-school kids discover an old video game console with a game they've never heard of--Jumanji--they are immediately drawn into the game's jungle setting, literally becoming the avatars they chose: gamer Spencer becomes a brawny adventurer (Dwayne Johnson); football jock Fridge loses (in his words) "the top two feet of his body" and becomes an Einstein (Kevin Hart); popular girl Bethany becomes a middle-aged male professor (Jack Black); and wallflower Martha becomes a badass warrior (Karen Gillan). What they discover is that you don't just play Jumanji--you must survive it. To beat the game and return to the real world, they'll have to go on the most dangerous adventure of their lives, discover what Alan Parrish left 20 years ago, and change the way they think about themselves--or they'll be stuck in the game forever...I liked this movie so much, it's unique and better than the first Jumanji, but Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle isn't a sequel, it stands on it's own.Anyways, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is full of action sequences which were very good, very talented performances in the world of Jumanji, but in the real life, the performances were bad, and it takes to another thing I hated about this movie, I didn't see so much of Jumanji or lots of animals as I expected to see. The CGI of the animals wasn't that good anyway. The story is really good, I loved every sequence of this movie, it's like video game but a movie, I loved it! The sense of humor of this movie is really funny, I liked that , but Kevin Hart with Dwayne Johnson scene was so Central Intelligence, I didn't that, but I laughed though.I liked Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle very much and I'm gonna give it a B+.Thank you, guys as always for reading my review, I hope you liked it, and I welcome all of your comments.

While it's a bit formulaic, Jumanji is terrific fun. I saw it three times in theatres. Jack Black is a joy. We get some nice range from Dwayne Johnson. Karen Gillan is fun but doesn't really seem to remember at times what it was like to be a teen girl. Kevin Hart pretty much is Kevin Hart but it's good fun. The kids do a great job as well.All the characters have some growth except the character of Fridge who really isn't a good person and never seems to realize that he's been a crappy human being for years.The best chemistry is between Karen Gillan and Jack Black. They are hilarious together.Had I been pulled into the game, there's no way they could have gotten me to leave.

Review title: Just ok to watch it one time.
Review_body:
Just ok to watch it one time with some pop corn. Nothing special.
Not enough interesting to watch it again.

I don't want to get into any spoilers, but the trailer gives you a good insight into what you are getting into. To me, the whole adventure felt real and it was brilliantly funny. I could't stop laughing ever since the game begun. It was fun, loving, and had really good messages within the whole thing. About friendship, love and ultimately, makes you think about who do you want to choose to be.

I quite enjoyed this film. I admit I don't have much nostalgia to the original so I went in as basically a blank slate and thought it was a nice family film. I don't think it's the best option but it's jokes usually land and the action scenes are fun. I think the general storyline is kind of weak and some of the jokes aren't that good, also it's pretty predictable and the main characters are a little annoying. But overall it's alright
Sometimes you need a film devoid of any modern politics and this Jumanji spin-off stays the shallow side of all that's toxic in Hollywoodland.

Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game called of Jumanji. The only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game. In that video game, they go into each characters that have individual fascinating skills and also weaknesses.

We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of this remake. The jokes are nonstop and witty. Characters are well fleshed out with each person playing a physical opposite of their persona outside of Jumanji. A little homage is paid to Alan Parrish at the beginning of the movie, and the movie continues, 20 years after the events of 1996.The Rock is always fun, but shines as a scared nerd with no confidence. Karen Gillan is adorable as the socially awkward nerdy girl. Jack Black playing a self obsessed popular girl is laugh out loud funny. Kevin Hart as a shrunken jock with many assigned weaknesses is classic. All in all a nearly perfect family comedy that rises above lowest common denominator humor. Worth the trip to see it on the big screen. You do not have to see the original to appreciate it. Not quite 10 stars because adult re-watch value is just not there.

Not as bad as I thought it was going to be. Goodacting, good story. Love the acting by the Rock and Kevin Hart.  However, even it was nothing like the original and the younger kids try too hard to act, it was just as amazing as the original. And they did send a nice tribute to Robin William's character

Review title: This isn't going to win any awards, but for an action adventure comedy, it hits its target.
Review_body:
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017) 
This is an adventure comedy film. It is a part of the Jumanji franchise, serving as a sequel to Jumanji (1995). These are based on the 1981 children's book of the same name. The film stars Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart, Karen Gillan, Nick Jonas, and Bobby Cannavale. The movie received generally positive reviews from critics and grossed $932 million worldwide. Viewers gave it high marks. The cast was well liked. This isn't going to win any awards, but for an action adventure comedy, it hits its target. The comedy is age appropriate, in that it's subtle and not in your face. Overall, a solid movie.

Review title: It's not easy to make me laugh audibly, but this movie did it!
Review_body: Humor that's plain funny, I find funny. Humor that's witty, I find funny. But either don't make me laugh. Humor that's human, that's what makes me laugh.A kid disappears into Jumanji, never to be heard of again after his father while jogging along the beach found the original game, which the kid didn't like because it was a board game, which makes it change into a videogame overnight, which catches his attention and he plays it and #goto the beginning of sentence. That's during 1990s. His father's life goes to ruins and their house becomes the freak house that looks like it's haunted, but the father, now a lost soul, still lives there.Twenty years later, a couple of kids earn themselves detention. A jock, once friend to the smart kid that fails to fake a different voice while writing the jock's essay. The smart kid without a sense of reality and obviously not a fiction writer. The girl that feels that everything is awkward and that has a natural attraction thing for the not-so-smart smart kid. And the girl totally obsessed with her phone, her appearance, and the way she thinks people see her.All of the video game characters whose avatars the kids ended up in really focused on counteracting the kids' perceptions of what they are and what they need to be. They feel they become everything they should or shouldn't be to be cool and then they die, come falling out of the sky with still a couple of lives left, crash through a roof, to resume their place in the game and have another go at it before they run out all of their lives. But first, they realize it hurts like a bitch and cry like a baby girl. I'm sorry, but that just made me laugh. And it wasn't the only time.It's only natural for kids playing video games to pick the character that's opposite to what they perceive themselves to be or to mistakenly get sucked into a character like that. The screenwriter throughout the movie comes off as a really funny and smart person that really understands the business of screenwriting, and anyone less knowledgeable would assume this is the case, but I, as the kind of person that played some videogames and coincidentally played the scrawny little thief with fascinating magic skills, immediately understood that the writing only by accident became this funny. There's no way the screenwriter, actors, or director could have on purpose made it this naturally funny.It's a movie that's clearly funny, exciting, and heartwarming by accident with everything falling into place perfectly. There's no way anyone did a great job on purpose. So just watch it by accident. Enjoy.

Review title: A boring mediocre adventure movie filled by unnecessary joke and drama, along with bad cgi moments
Review_body: Start with a slow pace, this move gave me the same movie experience when I watched Geostorm (2017): it's so boring, that in the middle of it, I just want this movie to just skip to end credits already. even when I saw the trailer, the movie just wasn't too promising, and man, I've never been feeling so wrong when I decided to just give it a go despite the former reason. the first Jumanji movie (1995), though not a masterpiece, was at least likeable to the point that it became almost the entire today's twenty-something's childhood. This movie almost do nothing but insult that beautiful legacy by just existing as a sequel no one even asked before (almost like the female version of Ghostbusters did (2016) to the original Ghostbusters (1984), and thank god I didn't watch the former on the theater, otherwise I just banged my head to the hardest and the thickest wall many times until I felt I had unwatched it). Sure the jokes make everyone laughs (and I hate to admit that I laughed few times too), but not all the jokes are the good jokes worth laughing out loud for. I'm pretty sure some of the viewers decided to use a cringe expression to some of the jokes, especially the ones that included male's vital organ as the laughing material. The action scenes were not good either, I mean, to the overall scenes, it feels like they were sinking very deep in the bottom of the ocean in the middle of a vast sea of talking, jokes, drama, and any other kind of unimportant moments. some of the moments with the cgi (and the plot) makes me think this movie should have been made into a tv series instead of a 2-hour long movie that ends up as a one of the year's worst movie ever set foot on the big screen (though I don't think many people would like it either). so, in short, all I was saying can be put in this one sentence: not even the comedy trio Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson-Kevin Hart-Jack Black can make this movie interesting to watch from beginning to end.

Review title: Funniest movie I've seen in a long time!
Review_body: I was hesitant to watch this as it seemed to have been overly advertised and just got sick of hearing about it and I've also never been a huge fan of Jack Black, but he has instantly turned me into a fan after watching this! Don't doubt me when I say this movie is worth the 2 hours and the money spent. It is nothing like the original, so don't expect that. But I will say I like it better than the original, which is hard to do these days. Jack Black nailed his character of a teenage, social-media-driven girl and had me laughing with almost every word he spoke. The rest of the cast added their humour as well which just made it an amazingly funny movie overall. It's not one that is so focused on the plot as much as it is just being plain funny, which is alright with me and great for anyone looking for a good laugh.

Jumanji is all an adventure comedy shouldn't be. Its pathetic, disgustingly unfunny and so mind numbing stupid that its a nearly criminal act that this film can be watched in the cinema in our days cause movies like this makes a lot off money on dumb people that haven't a clue what's makes a great film and they are literally paying for the downfall off Hollywood. Yes I'm saying that if these kind off movies is killing our love for films, and that is a very disturbing fact. For the love off GOD skip it save your cash trust me its worth it.

Ok full disclosure - I am just about the most critical person you'll ever meet. I can find fault with ANYTHING.But this movie was just alot of fun to watch. Don't overthink it, just buy into all of it and you'll enjoy yourself.Call out out to the great Tim Matheson (from Burn Notice and The West Wing). Great actor and director.

Review title: Much different than first but Smashing film 8/10
Review_body: Jack Black steals the show and Karen Gillan as Martha WOW talk about easy on the eyes -- I thought she was pretty as Amy Pond in Doctor Who - I believe she's getting more beautiful. I didn't even know she was in the movie. I don't think you can really compare it to the original because they are so different -- the first one was more dark & not as much comedy, but I love them both. If you have not seen the original go back and watch it. Enjoy.

Much better than original! And definitely not something I would call a remake. Family laughed the whole movie and I had several moments which means it had right touches of comedy, action and even romance. I believe it even had a moral story which was very good for all ages. VERY worth seeing and paying for.  I saw it in 3D which I can't always promote but had no problem paying extra for this one!

Pretty amazing actors, nothing against them. But the soundtrack adds a level of cringe that can't be ignored unfortunately. I watched it once, and would never want to watch again. A lot of scenes are super cringe worthy and I think the movie could have been cut In half of they took all those scenes out.

Review title: A humorous modern take on Jumanji
Review_body: Absolutely loved this movie!!! The cast absolutely nailed the movie.I like how they added the slapstick humour in the movie and the fact that they created the storyline around a computer based game instead of a board game giving it a modern spin on the movie.  They was never going to be able to do a remake of the original Jumanji the same way and do it justice and I think they did a great job of the movie. I'm slowly becoming a Dwayne Johnson fan.

This movie was completely entertaining. The comedic side of the movie, delivered mostly by Hart and Black was really funny and enjoyable.Johnson delivered a very good performance and, of course, Gillan was simply amazing.I was utterly surprised by Mr. Jonas's acting skills, he was quite good.This movie is not a remake or a reboot nor a sequel. I think the best way to put this is as a spin off.The children were portrayed quite well by the young actors.Overall this was a funny Sunday movie. I just can't believe it took me so long to watch it. Can't wait to see the next one.

Review title: The film is exactly what you expect.
Review_body: Saw via an early Unlimited Screening. Its no Oscar contender, but for a comedy adventure family film; it fulfils its purpose. None of the heroes use guns, although they do snap necks. They also show several deaths with blood splatter. So not for the squeamish. There are also scenes of bugs entering ears which can be off-putting.The teenage high school drama and love story is cheesy, as is the school bully / loner story arc. Its nothing we have not seen before. But it sets up the character traits and once were in the Jungle, it gets a lot better. It feels a little short, and some scenes like the Transporter Hanger was suppose to hard, but the lack of bad guys didn't make much sense. Every scene appeared to have been written to serve each characters death in turn. From eating cake to walking alongside a cliff. Trying to keep track of who had how many lives left let you predict who was going to die next. But it was at least trying to show character growth with each plot point and establish how these people change which is something I suppose. Removing the staples from magazines before recycling was nonsense. But that's the level of thought that had gone into the writing process. But again, its not trying to win any Oscars and is up against Star Wars in the cinema (whose stupid idea was that?) so I doubt its going to beat it at the box office. But once were in the game, its a fun, adventure film with four strong comedic actors doing what they do best. It excelled at its goal and is worth watching on the big screen.

Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle will absolutely shatter your expectations! It's hilarious, fun, and it pays a nice homage to Robin Williams. I had the best time in the theater while watching this, because I wasn't expecting much when I heard there was a Jumanji sequel. Since they delivered on every single level possible, it deserves to be praised.
This is a great reboot of an old classic! I was skeptical of this at first but I LOVED it!

Nick jonas drags this movie down with his wooden acting, he was the horror of this jumanji reboot.
Never felt connected to any characters, and was too predictable.
Dont know how can anyone give this movie a rating of 10! Even a small kid can see thru, how patched up this inane script is.

Review title: This is the second time I have seen this film, and I would see it again!
Review_body: A memorable film and a family film, well-worth watching again and again.
Like a rollercoaster of a movie, with thrills and comedy. The cast is great, and is given enough to shine.
The cast did a good job and Karen Gillan looks fantastic - like a little ginger Lara Croft 😊

This movie delivers lots of laughs and great pacing, decent action and special effects. The stereotypical characters are a let down, especially the token female who only gets to be sexy (come on, it's 2018). But if you look past the shortcomings, you will be able to enjoy Jack Black's funniest role in a while.

Review title: Not Original Completely and Kind of Annoying
Review_body: The kids in this film were very much more obnoxious than the original kids in the more original film rather than entertaining. Except the nerdy kid. Kevin Hart keeps playing the same personality in real life and in his films/shows that makes him look like an obnoxious snowflake. Dwayne Johnson keeps playing the same personality in real life and in entertainment, too. Jack Black is a much better actor than the other actors to me. Gotta say... the music was already worn out before this film began to me. Hollywood is just desperately regurgitating things for money to me. All in all, I had a hard time laughing when a bunch of out-of-touch teenagers were making me want to stop the film until Jack Black showed up.

I wasn't expecting much from this film, Dwayne Johnson really does make some shocking films. Not to mention I am not a big fan of remakes in general. This film is entertaining enough, a little light on details at times. I was confused by the role of the bad guys in the film and although it is a video game world they could have been more than just one dimensional in their nature and how they respond. Jack Black is toned down, for Jack Black anyway. Overall a fun film but there isn't a whole lot more to say than that, just fun relatively SJW free entertainment.

Everyone must have seen by now the classic original Robin Williams movie about a kid trapped inside a jungle board game who is brought back to present times after more than 20 years of confinment by two siblings who made the mistake of playing the same board game.
"Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" doesn't have the same charm as its predecessor, but it is a fun adaptation to the modern world.Packed with a great cast, "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle", not to be confused with the Rock's earlier movie with the same name, gets an "Avatar"-like treatment where a group of teens plug in an old console from the 90's and are teleported in the jungle world of Jumanji via different video game characters, in the likes of Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan, each with their own special set of skills that should help them retrieve a magical jewel and end the game.The movie is action-packed with an amusing approach to a sort-of video game adaptation of a fictional game. You will definitely be entertained by the silliness of the characters and how the teens react to their full-grown adult bodies.It became apparent that "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" is Jake Kasdan's freshest movie since his directorial debut "Zero Effect". It's one of those rare moments where a sequel to a comedy movie surpasses expectations and turns out be a crowd-pleaser, judging by the almost $1 billion box office revenue.

Review title: Never go swimming with a backpack!
Review_body: The infamous board-game as we know it has evolved, and this time it has taken the form a new system with new players. Having hit the reset button, does the 'Jumanji' from the 90s adapt as well as it does in the present day?1. Picking up where we left off from the original 1995 film with the board-game buried under the sand on a beach, it is discovered once again. Neglected by its finder, the game transfers into that of an obsolete video-game system which is jump-started by four students serving detention at a local high-school. From that point, they all are sucked into the world of Jumanji and embody their respective avatars they choose to serve as in the game. Keeping this spoiler free, the premise within the game itself is nothing special or original in the least. The players are tasked with finding a certain sacred object of which they must journey and deliver to at a certain sacred place in order to return to the real-world. They all have their respective strengths, weaknesses and abilities which they must use and work together while on their journey. The plot may be simple, but it serves its purpose well enough.2. This movie should be the blueprint for future comedies to show that raunchy, vulgar and excessive sexual humor isn't always necessary in making a film funny and entertaining. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie the same as I did with the original as a kid growing up. Though the presence of the late Robin Williams will surely be missed, I think he'd be proud of this film. Williams was a comedic genius during his time, but the humor delivered by both Jack Black (Prof. Osbern) and Kevin Hart ('Mouse' Finbar) will have your stomach in knots. Black in particular steals the show more so than Kevin Hart, seeing as his charter is embodied by the self-centered teenage girl Bethany (Madison Iseman). Black's acting and portrayal of his real-life counter-part was nothing short of outstanding. His gestures and voice in particular sold me on him being a girl trapped in a man's body. Don't get me wrong, Kevin Hart has his laugh-out-loud moments as well.3. The action was surprisingly good for a family film. I'm not sure how well younger audiences will fare watching this as there are some frightening sequences as well as brief sexual references and innuendos throughout. Unlike the first, this sequel is PG-13 as it takes certain and surprising liberties I wasn't expecting it to. Whenever there's action....call Dwayne Johnson, who literally delivers a knock-out punch with his performance as the daring Dr. Bravestone. I must say, I enjoyed Johnson's comedic chops in this more than any other film I've seen him in thus far. Never having been a fan of the Jonas Brothers back in the day, Nick Jonas (Alex) actaully surprised me as to how good of an actor he is. I used to cringe at his acting during his Disney channel run, but I'm glad to see he's finally bettered himself. I suppose there's no point in hiding my undying love for Karen Gillan. She's beautiful, deadly, funny and a joy to watch on screen.4. My only complaint and first major flaw of this film is the villain. Bobby Cannavale has proven himself as a good actor, but here he falters as the treacherous hunter/explorer Van Pelt. This movie would have been close to perfect had they not failed to include a worthy antagonist. Van Pelt could have been played by any actor to be honest. The character himself is weak and his goal is like any other cliche in which he wants the thing which the heroes have so he hunts them down to get back the thing that will give him power instead of the other thing happening. Apart from that, the cinematography and editing was phenomenal in this. The breathtaking scenery and shots of the various Hawaiian isles blew me away. Though not as cinematic in scope as 'Kong: Skull Island', it still urges me to want to visit Hawaii. If there was one other minor thing the film was weak in was the score. I felt Henry Jackman could have composed music more exciting.With his last film being the atrocious 'Sex Tape', Jake Kasdan has redeemed himself and proven to also be a good action director. If you're hoping this film to be a tribute to Robin Williams in some way, it really isn't, although it mentions subtle ties to the first. 'Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle' is by far one of the best comedies this year and is certainly on my top 10 list of best movies of 2017.

Review title: A Most Enjoyable Film Which Endlessly Pulls at the Corners of Your Face
Review_body: Who would have thought that the sequel to a much-loved classic would, in my opinion, turn into such a stand-alone powerhouse!?!Jumanji Welcome to the Jungle, does just that. Not only is it a virtual non-stop ride of hilarity and laugh-out-loud moments, and it is, but the chemistry among the adult cast members is practically flawless and lends to the easy banter and overflowing, genius, COMEDIC DIALOGUE which just SHINES. Every look, every gesture, every note from The Rock, Kevin Hart and Jack Black are perfection in that at no time do you doubt they are who they are supposed to be. Karen Gillan is adorable and gorgeous at the same time. The obvious fun they are having, despite what I imagine to be uncomfortable filming locales, is palpable, and as an audience member, _if you allow yourself to be_, you WILL be swept up and transported by it.So, why ANY low ratings?While the first Jumanji was 'fun', underneath the fun, there were dark layers. There is none of that here and perhaps, this is where some of the disconnect from its detractors comes from. Unlike the original Jumanji, Jumanji Welcome to the Jungle is a fun, and funny, film throughout. In closing, quite to the contrary of what a couple of reviewers are saying about Robin Williams, such as: 'he'd be rolling over in his grave (over this movie)', Robin Williams was one of those rare and amazingly special individuals who found joy and humor in most everything, and who chose to share that with those of us who are lucky enough to be witness to some of the favorites he left behind. Personally, I find it in very bad taste and verging on offensive, that those who seem to not share the capacity to laugh or live the way he did, or the ability to laugh with the rest of us, and who lack the gift of both being able to give or receive the very humor which exuded from Mr. Williams, would dare say he would be doing anything other than laughing riotously while munching on some popcorn and watching this film.Thank you, Robin Williams, for the precursor which was so fantastic, it brought about an equally wonderful sequel.You are missed.

It's four teens that are lost in a magic video game (JUMANJI) and the only way to escape is to cooperate to finish the game and go back to reality. I think that Dwayne Johnson (Spencer), Kevin Hart (Fridge), Jack Black (Bethany), Karen Gillan (Martha) and Nick Jonas (Alex) are so fantastic in their characters. This movie is the most mysterious, the most humorous, the most original because is a good cover and the funniest movie. And it is really little scary. Jake Kasdan was the best director for this movie. The special effects ars just really splendid and I liked are. It's the best movie I've ever seen. I recommend it 100% because it is the most captivating and the funniest movie in this world.

Review title: a good sequel to the original, and much better than I had thought it would be
Review_body:
A great film, lots of funny moments and the actors were really good; I particularly thought Jack Black played his role really well.
I hadn't thought Dwayne Johnson could do comedy, but this proved me wrong.I liked how they modernised it as a video game as board games aren't as popular anymore.
I thought it was really a good idea to add the NPC's and especially, what I sometimes find annoying in games, the set responses to questions and the seemingly ceaseless repetition of game objectives (its just a shame that every other NPC didn't play on the role as well as Rhys Darby did). And the player skills data was a good addition too like the character guide on numerous other video games.I liked how they linked it to the original film with the box being found in the sand where it washed up at the end of the last film, and Alan Parrish's house in the jungle.
It didn't occur to me at the cinema but when I rented this online I realised the 'bad guy' is called Van Pelt, a link to the 'bad guy' who was sucked back into Jumanji at the end of the last film.
Also, when the four other players find the 'missing piece' in the basket beneath the snake, they take out an elephant figurine which, if I remember the original film correctly, is identical to the game piece used by Alan Parrish.A couple of differences that I did notice however is that Alex was unaware of how much time had passed while he was in the game, whereas Alan Parrish knew exactly how long it had been and frequently reminded people of it.
Also in this new film, everyone retained thier memory of the events after returning to the real world, whereas in the original film the children, Peter and Judy, presumably had no memory of the game, or at least they made no effort at the end of the film to suggest otherwise (although it could be rgued that when Alan ans Sarah encounter the children in the future, the events of Jumanji have not happened to them yet as it was before thier parents had died).

This is overall a very normal movie nothing hard exciting. the pilot was unbalanced. the characters were that bad. the act wasn't horrible either.
this movie tried to be a good movie but failed by a tiny bit.

I really wanted to like this movie because after seeing the cast on 'The Graham Norton Show' they seemed to click so good together and they were so funny. So funny I was laughing really heard. But about the movie. It starts off exactly where the first one left off which is pretty amazing and awesome but after that great scene then the movie just spirals down to another 5/10 hollywood crap-fest. Filled with cliche moments, forced laughter and such cringe worthy moments I just had to look up into the ceiling because it was really terrible at times. True the movie has it moments and it is funny at times but the main plot is nothing like the original which I saw last week and it still holds up and that is a 8/10 movie even though it has some lame jokes here and there. But it's a truly amazing movie. But when it comes to this one. Sure it is entertaining and The cast is great but the movie is so poorly written and I was sitting there expecting a twist or something cool to happen but it's really lame if you compare it to the first movie which was and still is an amazing movie. The intro and build up of Alan Parrish story which seems like a Stephen King inspired moment, how it is filmed and the style and yeah everything. But nope I really wanted to like this movie but I can't give more than 5/10 because of all the terrible, cliche, cringe and hollywood nonsense it brings with it. And yes it is even a very weak 5/10. Disappointed.

I've always tried not to watch those movies full of such humor. People have told me that if I watch them, I'll never be able to stop watching them, and I'd laugh for hours and never stop. But this time, I just had to try. And it was true. I laughed my head off. This movie is very relatable. Even though it isn't the most meaningful movie ever, not every movie is meant for that. A dry sense of humor, Dwayne Johnson has done it again. This was a hilarious and acceptable movie. Welcome to one of the comedies of your life.
Jumanji 1995 is great. this is garbage. lame in every way.
Not a remake and very entertaining. Obviously, Rock and Kevin made it exciting and funny. Good chemistry and I hope they try another film together. Glad I took the chance and the family loved it too.

Review title: A sequel that makes sense for every classic movie fan
Review_body: This year, Movies that turns into sequels have turned very much alike. This sequel in retrospect, Seems to have kept the similar build from the 1995 film. It really made me wonder how Hollywood is creating these sequels that are geared toward today's youth and teenagers.Honestly, I don't remember the first film have so much sexual humor in it and some language. In my opinion, this was still a win for my money in terms of, Humor, presentation, and of course the generalization of trends that are starting to pop out of the ground in many parts of the world.It seems to me that this sequel really outdid the first one in terms of special effects and storyline. And it seems like there could be a third one.Jumanji 2 is still very warm to the touch and it's sort of got that Breakfast Club feel to it. You will see what I mean when you see it.It also kept aligned with it's original source material. Still though, go into this movie with an open mind. You will see the humor from the original hit movie hidden in it's jungles.

This movie is probably the best reboot to come out in the decade it's pretty original to what if it's copying off of its a solid in comedy Kevin hart the rock and jack black are really good together this is a good late night comedy I have hopes for Jumangi: the next level hopefully it can be good anyway this is a pretty solid recommendation

Review title: When Is This Going To Get Funny?
Review_body: Let me start this by saying, wherever Robin Williams is, he must be rolling over and raising his BUTT to whoever in Hollywood who came up with this script, cause it is wacked, or maybe a better word is, it sucks big time.It's not funny, it's to stupid to be funny, and putting Nick Jonas in this didn't help, but I'm sure the producers were hoping to pull on Nick's fan base of Bubble Gummers, and Gay Guys who worship at the Nick Jonas alter. The only thing this movie have going for it is the name for those of us to remember the original classic, and that's about all. I gave it three stars because it's not a remake, it's a first time mess up and even thou it screws up the premise of the entire first movie, it will never compare or even be as close to be funny, Robin Williams was a Comedic Genius, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Dwayne Johnson is only in it for name recognition. the girls, don't know what they are suppose to be, but they should have stayed home on this one.Anyway, if anyone reads this, let me say you some time, it sucks, it sucks so bad, the dog is hiding under the coffee table, oh my gawd, with his paws covering his eyes, if you have time to waste, this yeah, I recommend this, it can't get much worst, or can it???? You decide.

With a 7 out of 10 on IMDb, it's understandable why this film did so well.It's nothing like the original and doesn't try to be like it. It's, it's own film that pays homage to the Robin Williams original.It starts with a young man playing video games on what looks like an atari console, who was handed a board game. After the game turns itself into an Atari cartridge, the young man plays the game and gets sucked in. 20 years go by and four teenagers find it and also join the game.Jack Black stole the show, his portrayal as a teenage girl, who's trapped in a middle aged man's body, was perfect. While each actor did a great job, Jack's performance was the best.The humour in the movie was good, it wasn't forced, like I've seen in other movies, its more authentic.What I didn't like was the villain....he was very weak and it was horrible and boring to watch him.At the end of the film the four teenagers go to check out the freak house, which is where Alex lived and went missing from (20 years ago). They stand on the road watching as a silver car pulls up and a man and his family hop out. Older Alex is played by Colin Hanks, and he spots the teens and walks towards them.They immediately start talking as if they know each other and Alex somehow manages to guess all their names right. You think about that, Alex has never seen what they looked like in real life but yet somehow knows it's them from the game.
If I saw four teens staring at me, I'd be freaked out and walk straight into the house....But apart from that it was a good film, easy to watch, I'd be great to watch with the family. I didn't really think I would enjoy this movie, but it caught me by surprise.I didn't see this in cinema, I watched this at home in my bed room and the film looked and sounded great. It would have been a good movie to watch in cinema.I would recommend watching it.

Don't understand the naysayers. This was an enjoyable romp that doesn't need to be compared to the original - they are both good in their own ways. Jack Black is superb and has the character down to a 't'. Well worth an hour or two of anybody's time.

Review title: It is what it is and that its just funny .....
Review_body: Yes some parts are old liners, but for the most part, this movie does is job and it makes people laugh. Plus the movie went by fast which imo typically means its good.

Review title: I will never judge a book(movie) by its cover(trailer)
Review_body: This is perfect example of reboot/sequel, trying to br its complete different thing with some small but respectful reference to Robin Williams' Classic Jumanji. If they did the same board game then people would be comparing and complaining.I like these kind of sequels, other movies that try to different than original were Cars 2, Ralph Breaks Internet; but those weren't great themselves but Jumanji:Welcome to the Jungle stands on its own feet.Great casting choices. Jack Black has so much fun playing Bathany and the pee scene is one of the best comedy scene I have seen in a while. Rock and Hart has great comedy ( btw I hated central intelligence). Karen Gillan, her introvert counterpart, trying to be sexy and kick ass was hell of a lot of fun. Her complaining about tiny cloths are some great meta jokes about entertainment industry.Story and plot progressing were bad but its a video game and the writers have so much fun taking liberties with it that I have no problems with that.Some good thrills were brought with the concept of 3 lives and game over. All 4 characters finding about themselves and discovering the new rules and mythology with the audiences were great. Rock,Karen and Jack brings something new to the table but Kevin Hurt plays himself, while some jokes did land pretty well.One of the most funniest, highly entertaining comedies of this time.

Review title: I loved it more than I want to admit
Review_body:
I'm going to be honest, at first I really didn't consider watching this, specially because I watched the first one and I feel in love instantly. I mean, these days sequels to a 20 years old movies or reboots aren't that great, and I'm not that stingy with reboots, because I just want to watch a movie and not compare to the original one, I like watching it as a standalone. But with these one, I was so worried, but oh man, I love to be wrong in these situations.
It was brilliant, I was not feeling the modern version of Jumanji, but that was cleared in the beginning and it didn't bothered me that much, actually. The characters were amazing to watch, mostly because I easily related to them if I was in that situation with my friends. 
The plot was good enough, nothing new and unique, but it was well planned and cohesive, and that's one of the most important aspects of a plot. 
The game theme was so well written in this movie, and once again super cohesive and it follows it's rules, which demonstrates excellent writing and not just "for a moment in particular alteration". The cast was phenomenal, even though I liked The Roch way more before, it was still pleasant to watch him in a different role, actually more funny and interesting than I want to admit, and the rest of the cast I was already in love, specially Jack Black, who killed this performance alongside Kevin Hart and Karen Gillian (who I never watch before, but I'm already in love).
This is a perfect family adventurous movie, you don't have to watch the first one, but there are easter eggs in this sequel that are so special to those who enjoyed the first one, like me.
Give it a go, I can't promise you'll love it, but to me it's good entertainment

Review title: THERE Is a HUGE LOGICAL MISTAKE in the sequels!!! (But unlike other Sony movies, it was FUN,)
Review_body: If you make a sequel, you have to keep the main structure of the first movie. No, I am not talking about a board game turning itself into a computer game, that was ok.*In the first movie, when the game finally ends, everything have turned back to where it had started, to where when Robin Williams character was still a kid and the other two kids that had played the game many years later doesn't know anything, because everything went back to normal, so those two kid would have never played the game, in the future or past, whenever!You know what I mean if you watch the first movie.So the Jumanji game doesn't live a trace behind it, except for what has changed in the memories and the souls of the first players...BUT, the squeals made this huge mistake! The first player of the Jumanji game, the Alan character, remembers everything, ok, but how come the other four teenagers had played the game, if everything had turned back to where it started!!! How come that four teenagers had been able to play the game, if the first player found himself back in his room with the Jumanji game next to him??? Did he leave the game to the school!!! That would be so ridiculous and stupid!I guess the film makers have done this so that they can make another sequel with those four teenagers. And it seems they have gone over with it!I have checked the reviews of the sequels, but it seems no one have noticed this logical error!I think what makes fantasy movies great is that, it combines the reality and imagination, and it has to be combined so well that, the movie should be realistic, logical and at the same time has a fantasy in it that is believable, so that the audience feels that they are getting shifted to another world from theirs.These Jumanji sequels fails very much on this.

Review title: Hilarious characters and creative writing driven by a self-mocking sense of humour, packaged into a very satisfying Blockbuster
Review_body: Despite some moments of typical over-the-top blockbuster silliness, which includes a bit too much questionable CGI for my own taste, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is quite a fun ride whose qualities should satisfy moviegoers amongst several age groups.The film is more or less related to the original Jumanji film, making a few mentions of the Parrish family here and there, without ever making tight connections between the first entry and this one. Instead, this sequel takes a humorous approach, tackling the habits of today's youth, notably when the box containing the game is first handed to a teenager, who does not waste a second leaving it on a shelf, opting to keep playing videogames instead.The game itself is totally different: it's a videogame now, which sucks any player into a parallel universe filled with jungle, armed to the teeth mercenaries, different levels, cut scenes, and the likes. Players get to be the avatar that they chose, each of which has different perks and weaknesses. Although the script is more than often highly predictable and the moral of the story is beyond clichéd, the writers managed to compensate with hilarious character interactions and the "double identity" situation, which bring surprises and laughs aplenty. The cast does a perfect job incarnating clichéd but fun characters stuck in even more clichéd avatars, which are all tailored to be delivered with a great self-mocking sense of humour. Kevin Hart and Jack Black are absolute riots in this film. The biggest quality of Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is that it never takes itself seriously. It is a highly enjoyable blockbuster for the most part. It is still a blockbuster and, accordingly, there are moments when action, camera movements and CGI reach ridiculous highs. Its qualities, though, make up for these few annoying moments, and make it a quality character-driven comedy, thanks to the "avatar" twist, which adds a layer of humour that quickly becomes the film's main attraction. A surprisingly fun time not to be missed.

Review title: A Funnier Sequel to the Famous Robin Williams' Movie
Review_body: Well this movie was exactly what I would hope for in term of comedic situation and provided us a good amount of laugh. In fact what my wife and I noticed was the movie was a lot more comedic than adventurous. This was a bit different from the movie's predecessor, the 1995 version of Jumanji which felt having more adventure. Apart from being a sequel to that movie, this one also served as a tribute to Robin Williams who played the lead character of Alan Parrish. From my personal view, the original movie was something that truly blow my mind with the obviously awesome special effect at that time and also a wonderful experience seeing so many animals came and wreak havoc in the city. While in this movie, the characters were the ones who went inside the game and the animals scenes were not that frequent.The movie seemed to focus on the characters development and chemistry which were fun to see. I actually loved Jack Black's character whom I think was totally spot on. Kevin Hart and Dwayne Johnson seemed to hit it off very easily, most likely because they had played in an action comedy movie earlier Central Intelligence. Meanwhile Karen Gillan was totally different from the other roles that I had seen earlier as she provided few funny moments, with the funniest one relating to 2 bad guards. What I loved the most was the high school students were transformed into totally different adult persons and had to adjust themselves with their transformation. Though this also provided some rather crude jokes which probably not understood by young children. The special effects were definitely a lot better than the 1995 version (especially if you see the old one now). During the almost 2 hours duration of the movie, my wife and I had plenty of laughs and for me personally, I was happy and satisfied watching this one as it provided me with the light pop corn movie where I do not have to overthink and just enjoy it. Btw, there was no end credit scene in the movie which was rather surprising as I thought (and hoped) there would be one.Anyway, if you are looking for a fun, light, comedy adventure movie, then you definitely should see this one. If you have seen the original movie, you might also enjoy this as it had the aura and some scenes that would remind you with that one.
