This movie was really funny, witty to a point, and it was lots of fun. 
The cast are comical legends! 
Enjoyed every last bit.

Predictable. Not for kids. Why does the only female lead wear such a revealing shirt? Too many cuss words to let my 7 year old watch it. Every minute seems like they're saying some cuss word. Not necessary. We turned it off. And it's not fun. A contrived load of dung.

It is quite amazing how such a movie will get to meet its budget and then make some in profits and who is to blame remains an unresolved mystery. How can someone in good faith give a positive review is an insult to the previous generation of movie creators that have worked to their best to give moviegoers a quality time and not just please the average Joe and make the most money while doing so. As a movie Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle does not make your money worth at all, nor does it have anything artistic about it, and as long as everyone gets their paycheck movies like this one will continue to be made. Whatever passes is good to be shot as a movie I guess, and even more worrisome standards have gotten to record low in the industry, and have been doing so for some time now. I obviously discourage anyone to go pay and see this movie. Acting was alright, but the story and the script are as hallow as they get, and the movie is barely children friendly as well.

Review title: Don't think of it as Jumanji. Enjoy it for what it is
Review_body: Absolutely awful script in my opinion sorry. This was in no way as enjoyable or original as the first and only Jumanji movie.However the score is only for the idea and the writing. The acting was spot on, the comedy from Jack , Dwayne and Kevin was spot on, pretty ladies few action scenes . It's worth a watch but won't remember it.

If you gonna do a remake of a classic, you better be sure to live up to it. This movie didn't do that at all. The action is so boring, the jokes are not funny at all and the acting of Dwayne Johnson in this one is really off. Can't believe I sat through this entire movie

This movie relates very poorly to the original Jumanji. I actually watched this twice to see if I missed something. The original board game is found conveniently under about 1 inch of sand on the beach. The boy that finds it takes it home and sets it aside because it's a "board game". Overnight, the game spits out an Atari/Nintendo disk labeled "Jumanji". The next thing we know is that the Atari/Nintendo and the game disk are now at the school in the detention area. Really? It is not clear AT ALL how the game itself gets from the boy's house to the school so that it can be found again. The plot is overall quite weak. In this incarnation of Jumanji, the game apparently sucks you in no matter what - no riddles or trivial game moves that cause it. So, four teenagers are now in Jumanji-land - but they've become different people (the main headliner actors). They must break the "curse" caused by the new "Van Pelt" when he removed a large green crystal from its place in the world. The curse never really made any sense to me (and if it was ever explained in the movie it was done poorly) - It seemed as if they were just on a "quest". And, on their quest through Jumanji-land, everything that happens is obvious and predictable. I will say it again: obvious. The obstacles (animals, terrain, people) they encounter are like a walk in the park compared to those of the original Jumanji. And, while the obstacles do not seem very challenging to begin with, it feels like they escape or solve the issue way too conveniently. And then the movie dips into a lull and drags for some time - probably 15 - 20 minutes or more - and I just kept thinking, "Wouldn't it be cool if they did something here?". And, as for the new Van Pelt, we are talking about a very odd and poorly executed villain. Picture a greasy-haired stoner with one completely white eye, a strange gait, and really bad lines. And, I have to mention this: When Alan Parrish returned from the game in 1995 in the original movie, he was himself - it's hard for me to now buy into the "I get sucked in and become somebody else" thought process. I do like the actors: Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Karen Gillan, and Kevin Hart. Black performs his part well, as does Johnson. I liked Gillan's performance (but I've never seen her before). Kevin Hart is, well Kevin Hart. All in all, this movie could have been titled "Zabulido: Welcome to the Nonsense" and it could have been released as it bears such a weak connection with its supposed inspiration and predecessor. The cast and their great talents help to barely get me to a "4".
All characters are acted well, hilarious jokes , great story just a brilliant movie.
With respect to the first Jumanji, this "welcome to the jungle" is total and big THUMBS DOWN. It shouldn't even have been released.
Saw it . Liked all the actors. It was ok but I would not recommend it. It is what it is , corny and a little funny !

Review title: Just a little short of perfect
Review_body: It would be unfair, of course, to compare both the Jumanji films. The first one was made in a different time with a different plot altogether. The second one is more modern, tech-savvy and relatable to the present generation. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017) is a great watch and will entertain you completely. You will love the humor, the production value, the casting and the performances. Just do not compare it to the original, because when you do, that's where you'll start finding the faults. And yes, like the first one, I could watch this one too over and over again!

Review title: Different from the originals but still good
Review_body: Action packed and full of funny moments. Highly recommended!

Review title: These people have never played video games
Review_body: First of all I should say that Jumanji is one of my favourite childhood movies. Even so, I wasn't expecting this to be an exact copy of the original. I even liked the idea of bringing the game into a different kind of one (sort of digital), although the vibe from a board game is missed.No, what I believe is the movie's biggest flaw is not being able to MAKE YOU BELIEVE the characters are inside a game. Not even a videogame. They use some resources but, anyway, you never get that feeling, which was the hallmark of the original Jumanji.(That and the predictable overexplained script)
So crappy, the original had more CGI than this pos.

I was ready to dislike this film from the very outset, but thanks to excellent performances from the "in game" characters, I was drawn in very quickly. 
As a family film it ticks all the boxes it needs to. The humour works on all of the necessary levels and kept the children completely engrossed in the entire adventure. 
A couple of nods to the story of the previous movie keep things on track, although everything happens a little too quickly in the very early scenes.
Even if you think that a cheesey Dwayne Johnson film isn't for you, you'll be surprised. This is exactly the right place for it and his chemistry with Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan brings a great level of comedy to our screen.

For me this was one of those films where you are watching it and thinking "I could stay in this moment forever" and wishing that it the movie wouldn't end. It was so much more fun than I imagined it could be. The humour was brilliant and the acting was spot on and you never forgot that the adult faces you know so well are actually the teenagers that started the film, because they play them so well!Also I loved the little details such as in-game characters repeating their lines as it makes you feel like you are a kid again playing a video game as well as watching a great movie. The original was a classic and in my opinion this film took it to the next level with the use of new technology, imagination, a different angle, great writing and as I mentioned, brilliant acting.
What a fun story, joyful film, every character in this film was great. But I don't feel if this movie is a Jumanji.

They had it all. Promising actors and excellent story, but they spoiled a great opportunity.This movies has nothing of the magic the 1995 version had. The trailer gives the allure of adventure, comedy and action - a good combo. It does not deliver anything and is just another forgettable teen flick.It is hard to feel anything for the characters and building suspense is hard when you care less if it goes bad.If you haven't seen the real Jumanji yet I highly recommend seeing that one instead of wasting a couple of hours on this.

Review title: Jack Black Saves this Slightly Above Average Comedy
Review_body: NOTESIt had me laughing out loud at times as a slightly above-average comedy, but the laughs were pretty superficial so, I give it a C+. Jack Black is the true gem of this film, winning me over more and more as the film went on. Not much of a plot, hardly clever, but did lead to some moments that made me chuckle. I had to move to a different seat twice throughout the film as the viewers sitting next to me couldn't manage to listen to the film, instead repeating line after line of cheap dialogue. This tells me that even though it's not a great film, people seem to love it.REVIEWI don't know whether you'd call it a sequel or a remake, but either way "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" occupies a similar universe as the Robin Williams film I remember from my childhood. It begins with the Jumanji board game being found on a beach under some sand. Once the discoverer takes it home and realizes it's a board game instead of a video game he shelves it. The game magically morphs into a video game, calls to him, he plugs it in, and he is sucked into the game. Years later that same video game console is found by four mismatched teenagers while serving time in detention. Hmmm, Breakfast Club anyone? One teen is a self-absorbed, cell phone-addicted "hot girl" named Bethany, another is the intelligent Martha who is struggling with her self esteem. Spencer is the self-proclaimed nerd, and Fridge is the tall, athletic football player. After they get sucked into the game they discover that their bodies have become the pre-set avatars from the game itself. Spencer becomes the goliath Dwayne Johnson while Fridge ironically becomes Kevin Hart. Martha becomes the scantily-clad Karen Gillan, and Bethany hilariously becomes Jack Black. They are charged with saving the jungle of Jumanji by returning the stone to the eye of the jaguar and saying the game's name. After they complete this mission they are then free to leave the game. The unlikely heroes set out to try and return home, but are met with all the twists and turns of a typical RPG video game.There isn't much to be said about the plot of the film - the game comes to life - it's a clever idea we've seen before in the original "Jumanji." The added comic twist of the characters occupying their avatars' bodies is the fresh aspect. Dwayne Johnson, who often impresses me, gave a solid performance as the cowardly nerd occupying a hulk of a body. Karen Gillan, whom I've never seen before, gave a fittingly awkward performance as the insecure Martha. Kevin Hart played, well, Kevin Hart, disappointingly. According to the blueprints of the film and all the other performances, he was supposed to play Fridge, the big athletic football player, but instead he's just Kevin Hart making wild comments about how tall he's really supposed to be. Jack Black takes the cake here depicting the self-absorbed Bethany who is surprised to be a fat, middle-aged man with a penis.Generally, the humor is not particularly clever and doesn't contain much substance, but there are some heart-warming scenes throughout. Jack Black's character experiences the most character development and has the most interesting character arc, even though the film made it seem like Johnson's character was supposed to. The body humor does hint at (without ever seriously going there) the idea of being trapped in a body you don't want, and in a few instances makes it rather fun and comical (imagine going to the bathroom). Other than that no real issues are brought up or discussed despite providing the perfect vehicle for such commentary (a lost opportunity to be sure). The universal theme mainly concerns bravery and believing in yourself, and I will give the film credit for a well-deserved sentimental ending.I was disappointed in Kevin Hart's performance, or rather the way his role was constructed. He really took me out of the film. If they'd written or directed Fridge to deliver his lines in the flamboyant way Kevin Hart delivers his the continuity of the film would have been much better. The only reason I gave the film an above average score was due to Jack Black's convincing performance of a girl who is more concerned about finding her cell phone than the fact that she is now in a different body. The movie was nearly sold out on a Monday night a week after opening weekend, so it's obviously doing well enough with audiences, but these are not the audiences you'd expect to see in a slow-burning, dialogue-heavy, contemplative film. That said, I did enjoy the film, and I don't regret watching it, but I kind of wish I'd waited to see this one on a streaming service at home.See hutchnotes.com for more reviews.

The movie is really fun and entertaining - basic and simple humor style, unpretentious plot but worth watching if you are after some comedy
I don't really remember the original Jumanji so I guess it was not a masterpiece, this sequel may not be so faithful to the plot or essence (if had any) of the original movie but if you go with no expectations you will surely enjoy it
The movie starts a little bit forced, maybe trying too hard to put things in a way to make sense (in fact couple things are totally non sense), but after a short time it flows well and do the job as comedy/action movie 
It reminded me of cheesy movies like The Mummy Returns/Brendan Fraser
There are many jokes or situations that are more for adults/teens (the movie is PG-13) so that's a low point, specially if you have younger kids wanting to watch it because they want to see DJ/The Rock, although the movie in general is quite clean and simple

Review title: I was skeptical and boy I was wrong!!!!!
Review_body: Jack Black is probably the most underrated actor in this film. The movie is a great concept from the original movie with its own twists and turns. Overall funny film

Review title: I'm too much of an original guy.
Review_body:
I'm too much of an original guy! I'm guessing most people are younger than I am that are give this 10/10! 
Also not a wrestling fan ever so to see 'the rock' in movies, instantly puts me off! 
Watched and gave it a chance, just didn't do it for me what so ever! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because Kevin hart and jack black played their roles perfectly! They were the only reason I kept watching, I imagine the movie is great for kids, especially if they haven't seen the original one.

Review title: Awesome!!! That's all I can say
Review_body: This is the best choice for the end of the year - 2017. Most of audiences in the theater laughed all the time, this film is so fascinating and it was really good at relaxing people. After a hard - working day, going see a movie with your friend or your girlfriend, you will be refreshed and I bet you will have a good dream at that night.

Sincerely, I did not expect this film to leave a sweet after-taste. My memory of the word 'Jumanji' is linked to the late Robin WIlliams.Several high class actors are present in this film. The hilarious combination of The Rock and Kevin Hart make an explosive hit of laughter. Whereas, the unexpected behaviour of Jeff Black is too much to handle at times.A comical film with a sweet plot. It was worth the watch and would recommend to anyone wanting to see a comedy/adventure film.

I remember seeing the first one way back and the mark it left on me. You know when you hear the Jumanji drums the chills you get.. you know what Im talkin bout. This one aint that good for me but it sure makes you laugh. I like Dwayne and Hart workin together.
Worth watching I enjoyed it!

This is great. Anyone who's ever played a video game will enjoy this, it pokes harmless fun at game formats, blends it perfectly with the story, and everything makes sense when you watch it - for example, I read a piece by a journalist questioning why Karen Gillan is pictured in a different style of costume to the men on the poster - well obviously that journalist hadn't seen or even read up on this movie beforehand.To be honest, this story could have been written any time in the past 20 years since this type of game was already popular on the PC... but only now could it be brought to the screen with such excitement, humour and imagination, as most of us have a familiarity with gaming formats, and it works beautifully. And it just so happens that the cast are perfect for it, everything they do is tongue in cheek and you can see 'both' characters they are playing in their wonderful performances. Each brings something special to the roles they play.I'd like to see more sequels to this, I think there's scope for it.As a final note - it's quite clear to me that Karen Gillan should have been picked to play Lara Croft in the new Tomb Raider, it might have saved it; no disrespect to AV (now part of 'acting royalty', she'll be fine!) but KG has the magic ingredient - wow.

Jumanji 2 doesn't raise the bar in terms of viewing expectations, in other words you mostly get what you came for and that's not such a bad thing.
I don't remember being a huge fan of the first film, was never enamored with Robin Williams' manic excesses.
The second time around seems a bit more laid back powered by an enjoyable cast led by The Rock who truly deserves that moniker. His whole body is something to behold, serious granite going on there.
The young kids playing the real life versions of their more famous counterparts do a credible job as well with the obvious obligatory contemporary updates like cellphones and selfies.
The biggest laughs are generated by Kevin Hart as a reduced in size football star, a wimp now reincarnated as a kickass Dwayne Johnson (what a dream!) and a petulant self obsessed, prettily vacuous cheerleader as a rotund, spectacled middle age dweeb played by Jack Black. Didn't know the actress Karen Gillan but she more than holds her own as the wannabe vamp of the bunch with killer kung fu and dance moves.
There are a few modest laughs to be had here, nothing like belly laughs but some chuckle worth inducing moments.
I didn't expect too much so I wasn't disappointed. The dialogue was trite with the clicheed homilies of live your life to the fullest, you only have one life, let's go team, we can do this together, ect.... more than serviceable with nothing too deep. This is not a movie meant to educate or inspire, we're strictly along for the ride and the potentially entertainment value.
Did find the CG effects pretty shabby overall. The jungle never felt like the jungle, ditto for the animals, could smell a green background. Maybe I'm just getting used to the way CG effects look on the screen, these did not impress. A fun 2 hours, I give it a B-

Review title: A movie that makes you like it.
Review_body: I went into this movie thinking it would just be more studio garbage, but against all odds I ended up loving it! All of the actors do a Wonderfull job portraying their body-swapped characters, and the movie is surprisingly heartfelt and well written.

Article contains spoilers!!!Very few movies create a buzz when a reboot is planned. One such movie is Jumanji - Welcome to the Jungle. For people who have seen the earlier version, this one will be a different experience. With the latest technologies helping the makers of the movie, it is bound to be an exciting version!!!The main cornerstone of the movie - Dwayne Johnson @ Rock makes his appearance, almost after 15-20 mins into the movie. Along with him, the star cast of Jack Black, Kevin Hart adds so much value to the movie. Especially the dialogue exchange between them is humorous to the core!!!Jack Black is very natural and delivers the best that is needed for the movie. Kevin Hart with his witty one liners and expressions hits it out of the park. The others too have played substantially well to suit the need. However, it is the characterization of everyone gets glorified with the one and only THE ROCK @ Dwayne Johnson. I grew up watching him fight inside the squared circle, so for me, he is always THE ROCK!!!However, not everything is great and awesome in the movie. I am not going to comment on the story-line or the technical aspects because I ain't qualified to do so.. However, for me there were numerous instances where the CG work could have been better. Especially, during the climax, it was very evident.Overall, it's a weekend getaway movie for everyone in the family. Just go and enjoy the movie and as always I used to say, enjoy with a handful of popcorn!!!

I watched this movie yesterday and i had so much fun. It brought me back to good all times when i watched original Jumanji movie. Very good chemistry between the cast especially outstanding performance by Jack Black. I will not say anything else except it's a good fun for every generation and families.
Overall 9/10

Review title: Good not great but hot actress
Review_body: This is a good self aware movie about teens pushed out of their comfort zone and becoming better people, etc... Good dialogue and well paced plot. However, it had a whole different dimension due to Karen Gillan, who is really hot but not hopeless in her role..

Alone, Jack Black's character could get this film to an 8/10. He's hilarious as the 'teen queen' role. I actually found this film ten-fold better than the original. For serious. It's less scary and demented, and more modern and comedy. Plus, I can never be upset when gorgeous Hawaii is the backdrop
It's just great fun. Lovely one liners. Pure fun. All the actors play along with this story. And enjoy the ride. Jokes are every where. Comic book fun.

I'm ALWAYS a fan of the original over the remake; not this time!! I never made it through the first one!! Not even in 1996 and I was a teenager!! I never sleep through movies, but I slept through the original. This was a great remake. Full of action and comedy! Good job!! I think it's one of the highest scores I've given. 6 is dang near a ten for me!!

First off, I am glad that this movie didn't try to reboot or ignore it's predecessor, but it didn't force feed us references and cameos (cough Ghostbusters cough). That is very much appreciated. Second off, even though it never would have happened, Jack Black legitimately deserved an Oscar nomination for this movie. Never for a second did I not believe he was a teenage girl. He does so much more than just play on the stereotypes as well. Mr. Black gives Bethany a proper character arc, using subtle humor. He is the best part of the movie by miles. On that note, the movie does an impressive job of depicting high schoolers realistically, even if they are trapped in the bodies of video game avatars. Another performance that wowed me was Karen Gillen. I've been a fan of hers since Doctor Who and I was incredibly pleased to see her do such a great job with her character, a fun little play on the stereotypical video game female. If I had to pick a cast member I wasn't pleased with, it was Kevin Hart. He didn't seem to put as much effort into his character as the rest of the cast. It would have been better if they would have cast an actor who doesn't act the same in every movie, one who could've given a more talented performance. I also found that character rather weak. And Nick Jonas... sigh. The villain was fine. Nothing special. The introduction of his character felt really unnecessary and forced. I do wish the movie had gone a little farther with its parody of video games. It introduces fun concepts, like the cutscene, but doesn't really run with it enough to make it as fun as it could be. All in all a flawed, but ultimately fun and funny movie, even if a few jokes don't land.

I admit I'm a bit of a movie snob and totally expected to be unimpressed by this film but it was a very well executed light-hearted family romp! Lots of fun, everyone was funny and everyone played off of each other well with a different energy. Jack Black was particularly hilarious and surprisingly fairly nuanced as Brittany. A great way to spend an evening and highly recommended fun!
Jack Black steals the show. Just fantastic fun. Laugh out loud moments

Review title: Not a patch on the original
Review_body: It lacked the charm and humour of the original jumanji.It passed a couple of hours but i wouldnt rush out to buy in on dvd/blu ray.Thought the cgi was poor considering the technology that is available nowadays.

You better watch this movie before its gone from multiplexes. Unlike the old version of Jumanji, this is the GAME altogether. The Rock, Kevin Hart and Jack Black make an awesome trio just bringing in the laughter at different scenes across the movie. I found Kevin Harts character really funny and crazy :)... Leave the first few scenes until the group shows up in the game, then starts the fun right till the end ! Simply hilarious, worth watching :)

I really enjoyed this film. Yes, it's full of clichés like the nerdy and shy guy becoming the muscle who saves the day and the real-life muscle becoming awkward and insecure and then they realize that everyone has their own strengths and weaknesses and so on. There are also two girls who seem to despise the other's way of life and they also realize that the other isn't that bad after all. So yes, it's really basic setting with all that "emotional growth of characters" and "putting totally different and stereotypical people together and they learn to solve problems together" but still the film manages to be entertaining and great fun.The actors are great, they seem to have good connection and they work well together. Jack Black does good job as "Bethany". I usually don't like that much Jack Black's films, but he was really good choice for the role of irritating teenybopper. He really nails this part. I also liked Dwayne Johnson as Spencer. Dwayne Johnson is your typical video game hero, so he fits this role perfectly but I'm glad that his character wasn't just the flawless hero as such but made fun of him being such a beefcake and laughed at the stereotypes. If you are going to make a film with this stereotyped setting, you should be able to laugh at yourself and those stereotypes and this film does that. All those clichés weren't that annoying at all, because the film laughed at them also.For 9 or 10 stars this film should have had also some touching moments that make you cry and the characters should have been more compelling and real and not so stereotypical but all in all, this was entertaining, I liked the jokes and humor of this film and the actors do great job. Good family film that makes you laugh.

Review title: This movie should not be this entertaining.
Review_body: Going into this movie I didn't expect much. It's a movie with Kevin Hart Dwayne Johnson and Jack Black. I expected a movie with 1 or 2 funny scenes and sequences mostly due to Kevin Hart. But this movie is not this at all. It's easily Hart's and Johnson's best performances. Jack Black probably does the best job with his character as a teenage shallow girl and provides lots of comedy throughout the movie. The plot is intruiging and the movie is just lots of fun. Karen Gillan, who I had never seen before was also pretty good. Not only is this movie good but it has me hyped for the sequel (or trilogy if you consider this a sequel for the first movie).

Review title: I was surprised I genuinely enjoyed it
Review_body: I'm going to be flat honest, I went into this movie expecting not to enjoy it. It's a sequel 20 years later to a movie I really, really loved. And not to mention that Robin Williams made such a huge impact on my childhood and has sadly since passed, meaning anything anyone did would have to ultimately be compared to his original work, I expected to be tearing this movie apart.I expected to be doing that.But I'm not.Everyone in this movie really loved this movie and it came through. And they obviously loved the original too. They didn't try to reinvent the wheel, but instead redesigned it to fit a new vehicle. The game was still the game but in a new way that was still dated (feeling old and new at the same time) just like a game that is mysterious and possibly ancient should be. The characters chemistry worked well together, these guys are obviously friends on set and probably off too. And the dynamics of the story felt appropriate for kids my this generation, just like the dynamics felt right in the first movie for my generation.In the end I found myself laughing and saying aww and yes, even falling for the smoulderingly a time or two. If you go into this looking for a faithful remake of the first film you're going to be sorely disappointed. But if you're looking for a sequel done by people who obviously loved the original and wanted to continue the fascinating and amazing world of Jumanji, it's well worth it.

I wasn't expecting a whole lot from this movie. I was expecting something like "Journey to the Center of the Earth" and all its cheesiness. And I was expecting something trying to profit off of the original, beloved Jumanji movie. But this was actually a very good movie! It was fun, made sense, and was exciting. The plot wasn't deep or surprising but there is a lot of cleverness to it! The acting was great, and the jokes were funny too. I would recommend it!

Loved the storyline and acting. Funny and modern.
Yes, there's CGI and it's not all great. But it doesn't take you out of story.

This movie will have you laughing but at times also on the edge of your seat. In my opinion, a great take on the concept of the original, starring Robin Williams, with twists and turns and comic relief that create a very enjoyable experience. It out did the original by a long stretch and Jack Black's performance was utterly hilarious.

Review title: Maybe I Need To Take A Break Of Adventure Movies
Review_body: This film was unexpected for the most part. A Jumanji comedy sequal WHAT. But this movie was actually pretty good in my opinion Very funny. Some great action from all game palyers. To be honest I don't understand the hate at all maybe I just need to stay away from adventure movies. 7/10 Pretty Good

So the film has the eye candy factor going for it, but otherwise it is boring and the final adventure is lame. Karen gets them out of a jam by distracting the guards through her feminine wiles, but that is it. There is not much else to watch here.

Welcome To The Jungle !
Wow, honestly was not expecting this to be as awesome as it is and while it took me a while to watch it I was not disappointed. Without offering any spoilers I will say that this film offers some really great action and all the cast offer some fantastic moments throughout that will bring a smile to your face and keep you laughing throughout. There is a simple story but its simplicity alongside some fine action, cgi work and the great cast creating fantastic comedic moments you will not be disappointed by taking a trek in the jungle with this ensemble.
Personally would like to say that Jack Black stole the show, noting against the fine work of Johnson, Hart & Gillian but for him to act like he did in this role will instantly have you in stitches.
A great family film that is fun for all ages !
9/10

Review title: Nice sequel! Better than my expectation
Review_body: I actually come to watch this movie with low expectation. I watched 1st Jumanji and it was really great (and I watched it a couple times). The sequel is a little different with it's successor, with the theme is still same, a game that involved real adventures to it's player. Four teenagers sucked into the game, and they become a character they chose (which is very different from their real life). The movie is so funny, and if you played RPGs game you will find this really entertaining. The humour is still suitable for young audiences, so it's a family movie too. And while it's a humour adventures movie, it still have a good message. So I really recommend it, hope you'll enjoy it too.

This movie is pure fun as has been said in other reviews. Well worth seeing in theaters and worth seeing again. The idea of kids in adult bodies that are very different from themselves has been done, but probably not as well as this movie. We have a video game world that plays out with the idea that if you loose your lives it is game over. The actors do a great job, and bring out what is fun for these movies. Ruby Roundhouse and Pro. Shelly being the best of this movie. And of skill sets Dance Fight is a great skill to have that made me laugh. And the weakness to cake was well done. And the movie does not go in the direction as I was expecting with how things would play out. 
Such as in typical video game style would have one of the party be a traitor and I kept thinking which was going to be the traitor. This could have gone that route, but the movie would have taken a more serious tone at that point.
 
There is a nice tribute to Alan Perish, but this is not the world that Alan described from before. There are no Monsoons here, but plenty of other action. I kind of relate this movie more to Zanthura then Jumanji in a lot of the areas. 
two missing stars.
So there are few things that I am just missing and wished was there. And I focused just on these things I would have not have enjoyed the movie as much. So the these missing stars are really just for what was missing that I would have liked, but probably in the minority.  
Jumanji taking over the real world. 
The same video game style concept could have worked with the kids as themselves having to deal with a video game taking over the real world. Not "PIXEL" style but Jumanji style. This would have given us Spencer having to be brave as himself instead of being in an avatar that would make it easier to be brave. Really he did not want to go back in the end of the game. And if he rescued his girl as himself from a snake might have been different then smolder saving Ruby.
 
Instead of NPC, what if the people you know every day are morphing into NPCs. There is just something about being a kid, or adult having to face a jaguar in the world you are in without the cages. And I would have like to have seen Bethany who would be at home at the mall, having to deal with a mall turned into a deadly jungle. Killer plants at walmart on isle 3. But keeping it at the school would have been a great setting.The second is the threat of danger. 
The video game world is used well, but it is based on todays standards of multiple lives. Take this back to 1995 and you have one life but might have to earn more makes for different game play. And I am still wondering what happens if you run out of lives. Spencer said game over, but they did not get many things right in the game. So here there are three lives per person and is used well, but that takes a lot of the thrill and danger out of Jumanji. We do not have to avoid the hippos, we just have to reboot. Dr. Smolder threw his assistant out of the window as canon fodder just because he knew he would reboot this time. The old game would have penalized him as the rule was to work together.
Spenser wanted to stay there in the end. Alan Parish and the two kids in the 1800s never wanted to play this game again.The original villain of Jumanji also added into the thrill of the movie. He wants to kill me, for no reason. He just does not like Alan because the game made it that way. Here I was expecting the villain to attack the Smolder or foil him at every turn. The dangers of the jungle are not as unexpected here. The rules are of a normal video game, which I would have never though Jumanji to be. 
"You better watch just where you stand, the floor is quicker than quicksand"
Here the bugs are small, the animals for some reason do not feel that unique. 
Probably because the dangerous one was shown in the trailer so it took away some of the shock of the movie.A third is the rules of Jumanji
The game played was not the four that started the journey, but the one kid that started it 20 years ago. So when ending, the game would have gone back to 1995 (96). The others would have learned nothing of their game, but he would have meet them 20 years later. But that would have been a hard thing to work out with us just meeting the sea pilot in just a little while. And the others not really being friends so they would not be together in the end. But if they dropped the sea pilot or had someone appear with them while playing then the rules would have worked out. But that is the way. 
The games you play are safe. When you finish the game you go back to being who you are. You like being smolder, but at the end of the day you know it is just a game. So you mean the original jumanji is not safe. Don't worry about it, just go to the games you have and leave that one behind. Let's just say I'm hoping for a Never Ending Story 4 (non rebooted just continued on like this) and for a not safe Jumanji 4 continued on with a new set of people. But even if Jumanji 4 was like this one it would not be a bad thing.But that is just a time loop issue that the original did well, and the zanthura did well, and this one forgot or just ignored. The time loop would have lead to a darker movie though. And just thinking about about what all would have to change is why I do not make movies and just watch them. This time loop issue, is another reason I'm am guess that for most the weakness of a character is a one shot. I really expected the cake bomb to come back in the end.

I liked the original and so I was a bit confused when they made a second part after 20 years, but it is amazing fun, better story and great actors!
I really enjoyed it.
Way better than the original!

Review title: Lost the spark of what Jumanji is
Review_body: The original film was like a first foray into horror films for children. It was at times frightening, with the creepy idea that you could be sucked into a board game and have to survive in a merciless jungle until someone sets you free. Much like the original Jurassic Park, it perfectly balanced fantasy and horror with a bit of comedy peppered in to alleviate some of the more tense moments. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle throws all of that out the window, and turns it into a cartoony, campy comedy film. While the film does have laughs and can be entertaining at times, it's just a shame to see such a fun idea turn into a joke with no consequence or terror to anything happening to the characters. While it may seem nitpicky to say, it just has no heart. The original was fraught with sadness for Alan as he returns from the horrifying jungle to find his parents died pouring their life savings into finding their son. I don't want to see the Rock flexing every other minute while Kevin Hart quips in between for an entire film. This film is a Jumanji film by name only.
Fantastic adventure with well played cast and nice flowing script which ensures an interesting filming flow.

Review title: Feels like watching a video game with real actors!
Review_body: There have been quite a few attempts at making movies out of games, or movies where the characters are playing the game. Jumanji sets a great standard on what all to do in such a movie. First and foremost, this is not a movie that is related much to the original Robin Williams movie. The game itself is the only thing in common between the two, and that too is a cameo. So the game transforms itself into a video game to lure the young of today who are no longer interested in board games. So we have 4 high school kids who happen to find this game and end up being stuck into to, having to win it in order to get back to their real lives.1. The first thing that will impress anyone is that the characters are independent of what your true self is. The characters in the game are the avatars which the players choose to be. So we have a nerdy, thin, afraid, kid Spencer transform into D. Smolder Bravestone (Dwayne Johnson) and so on. The characters are pretty well developed. They take time to adjust to the reality of the game, akin to Neo in the Matrix. They realize that they have powers they can harness and only need to be confident. At the same time they also have limitations set on their avatars by the game. So we can see Dwayne Johnson transform from being Spencer to Dr. Bravestone. The best of the four was perhaps Jack Black who did a great job at portraying an avatar (Prof. Shelly Oberan) of a girl, Bethanie, and all the learning that comes with the change of gender.2. The story line is pretty gamish, which is perfect. The game has not just transformed, it has evolved into a video game. There is a back story to the game that they are stuck in. And this game has levels which need to be cleared. Plus there are side characters in the movie who behave like characters in the game, in the sense that they only have a set of responses to give.3. The music of the move is somewhere in between of an action movie and an adventure movie, which you need if you have The Rock in an adventure film. It isn't grand, but gets the job done.4. First time movie director Jake Kasdan does a great job as far as the action part is concerned. The chase sequences are awesome, in particular the where the gamers have a herd of rhinos on their back. The sequence will get you on the edge of the seat and bite your lips! It was amazing to see how the characters evolve and they each have their strengths which come into the play. The best thing he does is make the movie very unpredictable. The riddles which the game gives to the players sound like one thing, but mean something completely different. And when the true meaning becomes clear to you and the characters, you can't just stop going "WOW!" The only thing I found lacking was the use of 3D and I think this would have made just as much impact in 2D. But maybe 3D is the thing to make action movies in these days.Overall it is a great movie to watch and do hit the theater to enjoy it the best.

Review title: Excellent Cast and a Great Show!!
Review_body: Dwayne Johnson just keeps getting better with age. Jack Black and Kevin Hart are very talented actors who know how to temper their roles just enough to compliment the movie. Enjoyed this movie with all the action, unpredicatability and creative direction and scenes. High Recommend!
I didn't so much like the plot of the movie, but the actors were very good.

Review title: Not as good as the original one
Review_body: Too fake. Story line is teenage-fied. Robin Williams version was a million times better.
It's excellent and fun movie to watch. Haven't have this much fun watching a movie for some time now. Way to go Jumanji crew! :)

I started off with a negative attitude given how different this movie seemed to the original one. However, I was entertained throughout the movie, there were numerous funny gigs and I was really surprised with the after taste it left me with, so I think a solid 7 for the genre it is in is fair

As other people have said, I was not expecting that I would like this, but was pleasantly surprised! The avatars playing against the real-life personas was much funnier than I had thought it would be. If you want a genuine laugh and a subversion of tropes, this movie is for you! It also pays some respect to the original, and doesn't destroy any of what that one set out to do. The ending that came for the love interests was one of my favourite things because it really went against what most movies do. I'll explain further down (here is where the spoiler comes into play):The two outcasts had crushes on each other, rather than one or the other pining after the popular choices like most outcasts in movies do. Also, the popular, self-obsessed girl had a crush, but it didn't even lead to a romance, it just led to her development as a character - becoming more aware of the feelings of others, and helping them selflessly.I really didn't expect that refreshing change from this movie, but that's what it gave us, and I am happy I gave it a chance!

Review title: A movie with power packed smoldering intensity
Review_body:
Reboots can be tricky. While some click, most of them crumble under the pressure to shake off the barrage of comparisons that would be thrown at the movie. Last couple of years saw such horrible reboots like Jurassic World, The Mummy, Kong: Skull Island. But much like Spiderman: Homecoming, Jumanji succeeds to impress the viewers. 
Jumanji gets a modern age makeover where now instead of a board game it is a video game. Four teenagers with varying personalities are put together in a detention. Here they discover the Jumanji video game and enter the world of Jumanji as their avatars. Then starts the fun ride. There are enough plot holes like how did the video game end up in a high school from Alex's freak house. The movie uses time tested cliche - Four teenagers with some flaw realize their shortcomings when (literally) seen from some other's point of view. But the fun parts of the movie makes us forget them, at least till the movie ends.The movie does not take itself seriously, and that is a huge plus point. The plot of the movie is crazy, there are man eating albino (what?!) rhinos on one side and villainous henchmen with crazy mud racing bike skills on the other side. But such craziness has been ridiculed in the movie itself, which makes you fall in love with it more.The bigger plus for the movie has been the performance of the lead actors. All of them have created niche for themselves in the film industry. Jumanji has used such niche beautifully and built very funny characters. Parts where Dwayne Johnson(Spencer) stops to admire his own physique will have you in splits. Not to mention his hilarious display of 'smoldering intensity'. Kevin Hart is Kevin Hart and Jack Blake as a women in a man's body is perfect. Karen Gillan, who is this mean Nebula in MCU, comes up with a very charming performance.All in all, Jumanji is a movie that you can watch without any regret. It will make you gasp, wonder and laugh hysterically. It is definitely worth a watch.

Nice and simple movie with good humour. Not connected to the original Jumanji Style at all. 
A little bit dragged in the middle but overall good.
I watched it 2 more times and laughed every time! Great writing, directing and acting. Loved that each character got to "walk in someone else's shoes".
A very good and fun movie.The story is receptive and contemporary. Watch this movie!!!

Review title: Jack Black just makes this movie!
Review_body:
I wasn't sure about this movie, being a huge Robin Williams fan and a fan of the original. But I was pleasantly surprised. All the actors did a fabulous job acting like they were "new" in their skin. And Jack Black took the prize for me. He brought the kooky, hilarious and sweetness of Robin Williams and put it on display for us all in a wonderfully hilarious performance.
Years ago I used to also think Jack Black was only good for slap stick comedy. But he has become one of my favorite actors. From The Holiday, to The Clock Hidden in the Wall, to Jumanji, he is so versatile.And I thought they did a great job continuing the Jumanji story. Honoring R.W. with the side note to the home he made in the Jumanji world. And they did a great job exploring how devastating the game can be to ones left behind, and to ones left inside.It was so funny, I can only imagine Robin looking down and laughing like crazy as well!So proud of a Sony for doing an amazing job at making a movie worthy of the original.
Why did u have to bring jack black in this mess (the only good performance).it sucks when target audience of the movie are 6yo nerds.

This was a movie that provided a good modern twist on what was childhood favorite of many. Few time do these reincarnation deliver but this film didn't hurt the past film by taking a new approach. The kids outside of the game felt generic and replaceable but the in game characters were very enjoyable to watch. There were moments of cheese through this film but the film new what it was trying to do so it wasn't painful to deal with. I personally approached this film with low expectations but found myself buying it once i had watched it.

This film doesn't particularly fit the title of the film since it shows that everyone goes to the forest via TV instead of games like the original film. Also, some jokes are lame. However, I give credit to the casts performance especially The Rock

Overall this movie is very fun, but there are a lot of below the belt gender jokes that I wasn't too fond of. What video game character has to pee? It also doesn't have the heart of the original. The video game twist was a fun idea on how to make it more modern, but lots of people still play board games. Also, they figured out the premise really fast. The game flops back and fourth between the characters acting like their real world selves and having the abilities of their video game selves whenever it is convenient for the plot or comedy. Even though it felt a bit predictable to me and Karen Gillan seemed really uncomfortable in her costume I did still enjoy watching The Rock run around in the jungle.

The idea of a disaster film using board games is not a new concept; Zathura (2005) and Jumanji (1995) have both demonstrated how action packed, yet underwhelming they can be. The transformation of the infamous Jumanji board game into a video game now presents its challenges to a new group of strangers as they get teleported inside the console when serving in an unsupervised detention in closed, dark room. Despite having a rather sceptical concept for film goers, the promising cast ties thrill and humour into a film which lacks a convincing villain.Dwayne Johnson and Karen Gillan play the avatars of high school nerds as Dr Smolder Bravestone and Ruby Roundhouse respectively. Despite Karen Gillan performing in science fiction films and series, her role of an adventurer is lovable and fun. Dwayne Johnson also features his towering powerhouse of a body and leadership personality as he plays alongside comedians Kevin Hart and Jack Black. The latter two did not disappoint in conjuring the occasional laughter when the team were in mortal peril from some villain that I forgot about. Jack Black's role as an avatar for a female cannot go without credit; as well as nailing a difficult personality, we are also presented with moments where the character's gender dilemma provided comedic value. In conclusion, with its video game element, it certainly ticks the 'well, it is different, I guess?' box on the criteria of things to look for in a film. But who cares? The sheer amusement from unique troubles encountered by the dazzling characters is suffice for anyone to feel grateful that they didn't wait for it to air on TV.

I can't believe I saw a movie with a cast of Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart AND Jack Black sharing the screen. At the beginning, I thought the scary old man at the Freak House was a throwaway scene meant to show how timid Spencer is but instead he (and the house) were actually relevant to the story and to another main character Alex. I am all for the board game morphing. It's a friggen cursed game, you don't need to follow any rules to have it "make sense". Why not, y'know?It makes the dynamics of the main cast in the story better when two of the characters Spencer and Fridge already know each other and had a bond. They know each other's quirks and tempers. The tension between old friends is realistic. An instagram princess in an older man's body is clearly portrayed with the mannerisms and body language is hilarious!! The movie in the middle corrects my theory that the 3 marks on their forearm are just 3 lives. Each mark is a lifebar that's why it drains or takes time for a character to "die". Skill set/weaknesses menu was hilarious. In some games the text don't make a lot of sense so the Strength listed under Weakness made me laugh! The amazing reveal when the characters find out why no one could choose Seaplane because he was taken by a guy who's been in the game longer than he thought was both funny and jarring. Inconsistencies with the cutscenes weren't good but I guess some of the bad guy scenes were just for us the audience... perhaps. 4th dimensional?I enjoyed that this movie is actually a continuation of the story with Alan Parrish but we didn't have to sit through some out-of-the-blue revelation of characters making a connection to an urban myth they've heard of Alan like in some movies. Instead, they built on their urban myth of the Alex kid who disappeared! Nice take I must say. I don't even remember much of the other Jumanji movie anyway. And it highlighted the different decades's tech when Alex and Bethany talk about phones.In games I view lives as the number of chances but you really have one life. Martha cleverly used one of her chances to bring a special item knowing that she'll materialize in the game fully intact wherever the farthest character is. Smart! Cute ending too but I felt it was missing something.

Review title: Not a game like the original. Boring.
Review_body: This is totally not a game where you throw the dice and some magic will appear in the real life, either bad or worst. Not even like Zathura. For me, the acting is not bad, but the story telling is horrible. It should maintain the story telling same as original Jumanji, or maybe like Zathura. But instead, just some kids that suck into the game and trying to safe Jumanji. The comedy is good, laughable, but almost the end of the story, it becoming boring. Not a throwing dice kinda game, it is just a action movie in the jungle..1 more time i would say, dont go, coz it is boring story.
Really enjoyable movie! The movie is well paced, great cast, great action sequences. I think this is a must see movie, for all the family.

Review title: this was 10 times more fun then the last jedi
Review_body: Ok so I went to see this one knowing I could be in for trouble seeing as I didn't enjoy the winter blockbuster the week before too well but however this was a different story it was so much fun from begging to end there was something going on the action was full force and the humor was cute too and ruby roadhouse damn was beautiful this is totally a movie worth seeing
I was so sceptical about watching this after the amazing classic and original Jumanji but everyone said it was great. I didn't think it was god awful but I didn't think it was great either!

"Jumanji" (2017) is a new adventure that provides you a more in-depth look into the jungle that was introduced by the original "Jumanji" film in 1996. Different than the 1996 film, this adaption makes the game of Jumanji relevant to this time by transforming itself into a video game (although I would argue board games are making a come back). For those with positive memories of the 1996 film with Robin Williams, one could be nervous that director Jake Kasdan would ruin that feel-good fighting spirit they found in the original. For that nostalgic among us, the film provides a few subtle "shout-outs" to the original film that will happily send you down memory lane. For example, this film begins almost identical to the 1996 version. A boy, Alex (Mason Guccione and Nick Jonas) finds the Jumanji board game while running by the water. When Alex is more interested in his video games, the board game transforms itself into a video game version of itself. While unbelievable that a board game would have that much power, it is not a far stretch of the imagination when you then realize that this game has now sucked multiple people into it...literally. The evil hunter Van Pelt (Bobby Cannavale) is also reintroduced, though he leaves his normal jungle hunting garb back in the 90s. Additionally, and probably the best throw-back Kasdan included is the reference directly back to William's character, Alan Parrish while we see the new characters in a tree house that Parrish build during his 26 year stay in Jumanji. Kasdan assembled a great cast including Dwayne Johnson (Spencer), Kevin Hart (Fridge), Jack Black (Bethany), Karen Gillan (Martha), and Jonas. Like his previous movies, Kasdan added a lot of humor into this film, which had me and the audience audibly laughing at times. I am beginning to really enjoy the comedic duo that is Hart and Johnson as they complement each other well. The acting was well done across the board and one could tell the actors had a good time making this film. Black's performance must be complimented as it is no small feat to play a cell phone obsessed teenage woman stuck in a body of a middle-aged man. Overall, Jumanji is a new part of the adventure that introduces the story to a new generation and makes it relevant to new viewers. If you go in thinking it is a continuation of the original 1996 film you will be disappointed, however, with fresh eyes one can enjoy the newness of this film and the humor it brings to the Jumanji storyline. Recommendation: Worth the laughs

The old one will always be the best for kids at that time, and it is true that animals show up in real world is more impressive than going into virtual reality.The actors, especially Jack Black did their job pretty well, both kids and adults around me kept laughing during the whole movie and I knew that this is definitely a well designed entertainment.We really miss Robin, and this is a good movie to cheer us up as well as to commemorate him.

Took me a little while to finally getting around to watching this film but it was worth the wait. The brilliant humour of Kevin Hart & Jack Black is enough to make any film worth the wait. Then when you add Dwayne Johnson into the mix you just know the film is gonna be awesome. I definitely gotta be this a 10/10 and I look forward to the sequel, it is always on my watch list.
Roll on 2019 - Jumanji 2
Nobody beats Robin Williams but this movie is not too far behind the original. It did a good job updating it to this generation of humor.
Sub par writing meets inappropriate casting. Highly unoriginal.

Review title: Then let's be like this everyday.
Review_body:
Jumanji is a good film but this sequel is much better .
Making most of the setting being in the video game, this movie keeps nice balanced tension. When I was a child, Jumanji was rather a horror movie than a comedy. Although its ratio is completely reversed, the essence of the horror in this series seems to remain unchanged. That is to say, fear of death. This existence makes the jokes shine much more and prevents the tension from going away. However good what the principle said is, in ordinary situation, it won't impress you. It is not until you realize the end of your life is inevitable that the lines of the principle win the hearts and minds.
I appreciate the actor's fabulous act. Everybody well played each high school student in it. I like the awkward kiss scene the best out of every kiss scene.
:We always only have one life. That' how it is.

Review title: I dont ususally rate movies but its getting worse to me
Review_body: Some actors are just wasn't born to act. I will not let my kids watch this due to it has nothing to offer besides a high budget. It is not funny to me and I'm trying to figure out was this a reboot are remake. Besides I don't see these actors to be role models due to their comprehensive action they done this year, having all of there private lives go public just to make statements trying to justify themselves.

A remember watching this in 3D. One of the most memorable 3D movie watching experiences i had in my life. If you don't care about the plot that much and are just looking for something fun to watch, this movie is for you.

Review title: My favorite movie of all time
Review_body: It shocks me that's this only has a 6.9!!! This is one of my favorite movies I've ever seen. It is so funny every time I watch it. And even though I've seen it about a 100 times it never gets old. 10/10 would recommend.

Review title: I really must be missing something here
Review_body:
First off, I cannot tell which age group this was geared towards. 
Second, I may be a bit harsh because I am grading with no curve - the first installment had Robin Williams, a master of comedy. This one had Kevin Hart and The Rock, who together could never be as funny as Robin Williams by himself.
Third, there were so many political intro's in the film that it felt a bit smarmy.
Fourth, I totally get the CGI bit in modern movies, but it has to make SOME sense on SOME level. Several fails in this movie here.
I guess asking for any character development is a bit much for an action/comedy, but I will still ask, and there was minimal, if any, chemistry in this movie. 
Probably best for the 12-17 crowd.

Not sure what to expect, I went into Jumanji with an open mind. I'm not a huge fan of the original, so was interest in what was in store.This film is definitely action/comedy rather than just action, as the writing seems to treat both aspects with equal importance. The gags are generally funny, but can get too much at times as the film seems to loose focus. Anyone looking for constant action may be disappointed.The characters seem to be chosen to empower various young stereotypes, which can only be a good thing. However, for adults watching alone it may be slightly annoying. Welcome to the Jungle is worth a watch for anyone who enjoys a lighthearted blockbuster type adventure.

Review title: Just as good as the original
Review_body: Really enjoyable, so many laughs! The movie is well paced, great cast, great action sequences. One reviewer on here said that it was awful, with no laughs, and that the audience were totally silent... he must've seen a different movie to me! The audience that I was a part of were definitely not silent! I liked the way they made the jumanji board game into a video game, it doesn't take anything away from the original movie. I think this is a must see movie, for all the family.

Review title: Great fun with lots of laughs
Review_body: Watched this at the cinema with my family, really enjoyed it! Great story, great acting and lots of laughs had! Light entertainment for the whole family! Especially loved Jack Black as Bethany!

This is just a sequel mockup of known actors, a vague plot, and the lowest of the low in humor. It's not worth your money. It's entertainment quality is sub-par and the many things it tries to be and how it tries to modernize Jumanji into a video-game doesn't appeal to the majority because the majority of non-video gamers would not understand RPG concepts without being explained about it and even RPG lovers would feel like this is just a gimmick and low-hanging fruit to sell a bad movie.

Jumanji was one of my childhood favorites. The older version, because of its originality, had a good mix of fun, excitement and visual treat. I watched the newer version anticipating it to be the better version of the original idea, but got disappointed. While Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a good entertainment, it lacks the excitement and surprise factors that original movie presented. The plot begins in a very similar manner to the older version but instead of a board game, we see an electronic version of Jumanji. The movie progresses with the characters getting sucked in the game's reality to accomplish the challenge posed by the game's plot. Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart successfully carry the responsibility of entertaining the audience but the story-line doesn't allow the characters to be memorable. The movie contains a few scattered pieces of good entertainment that makes you laugh. Like the original version, new Jumanji carries many special effects and welcomes you to the Jungle as name suggests. But we are in the year 2017 - I expected a bit more from the visual effects.
Overall, it's a good entertainer but is just an incremental improvement from the original version.
Kind of funny for the first 60 minutes. Then just trails off into one-liners and teachable moments. This movie is too long. *Warning: Kevin Hart is more annoying than usual in this.

I can't even begin to comprehend how this movie got better reviews than the original from both users AND critics. I hope that changes as time goes on. Terrible acting. Little to no suspense. I'm not one of those people who is automatically against a remake, but this one was just pure rubbish and a waste of everyone's time. Beyond disappointed and can't believe people are giving this decent let alone GOOD reviews. Just re-watch the original.
Great movie. Funny and for the whole family. It put a good spin on the classic film. I also liked the majority of the cast.

I really thought this movie would suck. I thought it was a reboot, which I usually don't care for but it's more of a sequel. And like reboots, sequels also often suck but this one doesn't. Not only is it very funny but I thought the acting was pretty good as well; this time Jumanji is a console game and the main characters get pulled into the game and get the body of the avatar they chose but they still have their original personality which doesn't always match the persona of the avatar. So as an actor you have to do a credible impersonation of a fictional personality in the body of another fictional personality. I also liked the fact that they really managed to incorporate a lot of console game features into the movie so it really feels like they are in a game; each player has 3 lives and different strengths and weaknesses, there's a map of the level and the game characters actually resemble those of a real console game. I also loved the fact that put Jack Black in the movie because that guy rocks.

Review title: A great story with a great action and good acting
Review_body: Oh my gosh, where should I start? This movie was simply awesome. At first, I was very skeptical about it because I knew how good was the first Jumanji movie, however I decided to give it a try and it was absolutely worth it. The story is very well constructed as the audience can quickly understand the plot, without being puzzled or confused which would've been frustrating, of course. From the very beginning you can see the main cause that leads to the entire action, which for me is awesome, because I hate movies who need like an hour in order to get into action and they are boring the audience until then. I appreciated the combination between the entire action and comedy elements which were extremely well introduced and executed by the actors. The dialogues between the characters are cursive, without many "dead moments" and easy to follow. The characters are also very diverse and well-constructed as we have some stereotypes here: the nerd, the hot girl, the tough guy and the shy girl. Exactly this diversity between them helps the characters to form a team and fulfill their objective: rescue Jumanji. What's even more interesting is that this stereotypes are switching between them as soon as the characters are entering the game.What could've been done better about this movie is the CGI which is rather acceptable, than good, but oh well, you cannot have them all in a movie, right? Overall, this movie deserves your time and I recommend it, especially to those of you who are gamers.

This movie was great from start to finish. I really liked how they done this one using the finesse of how kids today prefer video games to board games. I was laughing from start to finish.Everything about this movie was great.

Review title: Enjoyable but not what I expected!
Review_body: I have seen the Jumanji animated series and loved the '95 movie, from what I know Jumanji has a creepy and frightening setting, it's supposed to make you feel uneasy, but the movie doesn't give that vibe at all it just feels like an another jungle adventure movie.The movie feels a bit predictable, there's a sudden personality change in the characters and some of the scenes just make you cringe, but what it lacks in the story it makes it up with the cast. The chemistry between the cast is amazing, coupled with some good punches it manages to keep the movie afloat.

Review title: Total waste of money and time
Review_body: This is not Jumanji.. the producers just stole the name for the sake of marketing... No wonder it's clocking close to a billion dollars in collection. It's a waste of time and money. The director has not made any effort on the script or screenplay to make the movie interesting with surprises. It's a third rate movie according to me. Don't spend on watching this movie. You will regret as I am.

Cheap jokes, brainless plot, each episode of SpongeBob SquarePants has better and more original plot than this. but maybe your ten yrs old kids like it. that's enough, enough said for such kind of movie

Review title: DJ would take any script he could get his hands on these days....
Review_body: It's as though the characters were improvising their lines, making their words up as they go along. No actual thrill of adventure or danger with a story like this, it's as though the whole film was just a big set up for a laugh and that's it.The villain was not even a villain, played absolutely no role in the story whatsoever and played no threat to the main characters.Kevin Hart, again, being the scaredy cat of the cast and shouting his lines out to the audience as per usual, seems like the easiest job in the world today, although i have to say still the funniest (regardless of how forced the jokes were).Lost all respect for Jack Black taking this role on, then again it's not as if he's a big time actor anyway so this fits the bill for him.Karen was just eye candy because fan-boys demand it. thats all. This one was frustrating because its not the worst film I have seen but I would not look to this film for a laugh or enjoyment of any sort, it's just another project on DJ's CV, he's got his star on the walk of fame now, he can just hang up the towel now. To add, if you're going to create a character name for this guy, don't have it be the same first name he's already portrayed from Ballers, because if anyone watches that show, that's all they're gonna be thinking about when his name is mentioned.

Jumanji 2 was an awesome movie. It was better than Jumanji 1. When I sat in the theater to watch it, there was laughter everywhere. The movie was really funny. I thought all the funny parts would be in the trailer but not in this movie. In Jumanji 2, 4 characters get stuck in a jungle. Each character has 3 lives. They need to put a stone in a statue to go back home.
 When I went to the the theaters to watch this movie, the line was very long but it was worth waiting. The movie was the funniest I have ever seen. There was lot's of action but also a lot of humor. Laughs came everywhere. 
 Clearly, I thought the movie was amazing. There was humor, action, and a story. You should watch Jumanji 2.

Review title: The shame of being a traitor
Review_body: I've got to admit I didn't want to watch this because I love the first one but I'm so glad I did, I thought it was absolutely brilliant and I feel bad for loving it so much

Using the washroom after viewing this movie had me more on the edge of my seat than the film itself. Average cinematography, the characters were stereotypical and boring, the plot was highly predictable and trite (as in, there was no part of the entire movie that caught me off guard or that I didn't expect), and the scenes that were apparently meant to be suspenseful or exciting were not. The film was full of cheesy, forced dialogue and pointless romantic subplots (one of my biggest pet peeves in action/adventure movies). It did have a few funny moments, which is just about the only thing that made me give it higher than a 1/10 rating.It's not the worst thing I've seen in my life, and to be fair I don't usually watch this genre of movie (it was the one my cousin wanted to see), but around halfway through I definitely was bored and looking forward to the end. In hindsight, I wouldn't have spent $10 and two hours on this. It's probably an all right family movie or an appealing plot for a 12-year-old, but for me it was a total yawn.

I remember watching the old one more than a hand full of times! This new one is more than I expected. Thought it wouldn't hold up to the old movie but I was wrong. I can tell you we have watched this way more than a handful of times! Great acting 👍🏻

Review title: Good film but not really like Jumanji the original
Review_body: I enjoyed Jumanji it has alot of funny parts and fun moments Foe me though i would of liked it to of been more in tune with the original jumanji. For example in the first jumanji all the creatures that came out of the board were not in this film. I also think some sort of reference could of been made to robin williams .A few things did play on my mind like why did Alan from the first jumanji and the boy who had been there for twenty years not just gone into the village and made a new life for themself. Anyway still this is a good film to watch lighthearted and great for the whole family. Worth a watch.

If you like action movies, go ahead!
On the other hand, I advise against those that insects-and other dark beings in the jungle-scare.The tattoo system to represent lives is a good idea to avoid recalls with the cartoon. On the other hand, the landing of the characters in the Jumanji universe is a bit confusing at first.
The end left me rather perplexed... why they leave the console in this state...???

Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle 
2017Fun movie. I was impressed. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has come along way over the years. At the beginning of his acting career I really didn't like The Rock. Perhaps I was persuaded by his pathetic and embarrassing performance as a wrestler. But recently, I've become a fan of The Rock and feel he's becoming a quality actor. I was skeptical about this movie from the beginning but was surprised at how much I enjoyed it. I found myself laughing throughout. Not to mention it keeps making money at the box office.The movie is about a group of misfits in detention that stumble across a vintage video game system. When they set it up and begin to play they are sucked into the game actually becoming the individual characters of the game, complete with a number of lives, strengths and weaknesses. The film is convincing as an actual video game and gives video games styles appropriate credit. The action and visual effects are impressive and entertaining. Jack Black gives a convincing performance as a ditzy, popular, sexy blond that is addicted to her phone. Johnson seems to be the typical role as the strong hero with no weaknesses that seems to lead the team. Kevin Hart is his usual self as Fridge, a small whiney character in the game, a very different person than the football jock from the real world. (Assume that's where his name 'Fridge' comes from) He seems to have an insignificant role as Johnson's side kick, but quickly adapts, accepts and contributes. My favorite character was Martha, the nerdy girl that seems to see the world clearly with all its superficial and unimportant elements. She becomes a martial arts babe who has a sexy and rare ability for dance fighting. See the movie for more info, I don't want to spoil anything. Her performance is funny and entertaining. I love the way she kicks some tail and thinks through situations assisting the team. Because the film takes place in a video game setting some action is convincing and believable when in other movies it might appear ridiculous or far fetched. Flying a helicopter sideways for example. In a Mission Impossible movie it may force us to roll our eyes and mutter: "Seriously? Come on." It has the ability to exaggerate reality laws, much like the Matrix movies. I was a little disappointed with a few inappropriate and completely unnecessary sexual jokes and some romantic drama that was included in the story that didn't seem to fit. Some may appreciate it, but I felt the film could have done without it. Can I mention this? I know others are hesitant to address it. In every movie Johnson shows off his impressive chest tribal tattoo. Instead of seeing the character in the movie I see The Rock, playing that character. The Rock looks the exact same in every film he is in. Just like Baywatch, a post for another time, instead of Mitch Buchannon, I'm seeing Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson playing a lifeguard in a movie. The same goes for every other recent movie Johnson has been in. We all know his tattoo, and what it looks like. It's as if Johnson refuses to be anyone else, other than himself, for any movie. Fast and Furious? San Andreas? GI Joe? See where I'm going with this? Could we please have hair and makeup strive to show some effort in converting Johnson into the actual character in the film? Do I even need to add a reference to the character transformation of Gary Oldman for the film Darkest Hour here?I really do miss PG movies that are appropriate for all ages. They seem to be very rare now days. It would have been nice if a little bit of unnecessary content would have been filtered from this movie to give it the PG rating, so that kids could enjoy it as well.Overall the movie was a lot of fun. One I'd see again and recommend to others. I can see why it keeps making money at the box office.

Review title: Nice cast on paper - but better go see the original from 1995
Review_body:
With Robin Williams (RIP), a young Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt and others. 
They had a nice notion of making a comedic espect of it using "body swap" (the big muscular in the game is actually a weak nerd in real life, the popular girl is a middle aged man etc. - that's pretty much it.Like this game, some things should be left alone .
This movie is excellent. Everything works: rhythm, characters, jokes, plot, action, even the messages are good. I was highly entertained. Oh, and it's hilarious!

Perfectly chosen actors, superbly made movie, intensely funny, I do not remember when I sincerely laughed at comedy but kevin managed to smile at almost every scene
My advice to every comedy director to hire kevin
And one more thing, I do not like reddish but karen burns

Really nice movie the humor was pretty good. The scenario is well done. I think the actors acted pretty well their roles. I did not really like the way the guy at the beginning (the first to get sucked in jumanji) was not shocked after the board game suddenly turned into video game. He did not even ask himself that it was kind of weird, no he just plugged the game in and played.

I don't usually leave reviews, however with Jumanji being a very iconic movie from my child hood, I felt a review would be needed. I like the way how the film has changed along with times, in 1995 Jumani, you had the board game, and the same with Zathura. Fast forward to 2018 and everything is pretty much virtual. The acting was absolutely fantastic, Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black and Kevin Hart were absolutely brilliant with Jack Black providing many laugh out loud moments. Karen Gillen stood tall in the movie and performed amazingly well. Her character was very memorable and bad ass (I kept expecting Matt Smith to pop up every time she was on screen)Why a 7 out of 10 though?
