For me personally to rate a movie 10 out of 10, it has to tick many boxes, and when it's a remake or sequel to an iconic classic movie, 10 out of 10 is near impossible. A perfect example of this would be Jurassic world, a movie I absolutely loved but only rated a 7 because it didn't stand toe to toe with the original. There was far to much comedy and not enough dark moments in this movie which I felt let it down. Those who have seen the original will know of some of the dark moments.

Performances were great and i'm looking forward to the next one.

Review title: Very Fun and interesting, For the first half of the movie
Review_body:

Secondly, the only link it had to the first movie was Van pelt and the name Alan Perrish scribbed on a piece of wood in a jungle. the first movie was iconic for it's fantasy look animals and plant, and mischief monkey, persistent flesh eating plants, and the grunting and panting baby running Rhino, in additional to the new animal threats, they should have at least featured them in the second movie.. it would have been a plus...
but over all a fun and thrilling movie, with soo much potential to be cult movie

Review title: Better than anticipated, refreshing take on an exsisting IP
Review_body: Went in with no expectations, thinking this will be yet another cash-in remake but was happy to be wrong. A refreshing take on an enjoyable childhood movie. Nothing spectacular about his movie but it was a fun watch with a solid cast that have a better chemistry than expected. It doesn't take itself to seriously but that's the kind of movie it's meant to be.Kevin Hart usually puts me off anything but they even managed to use his style appropriately in this movie and I almost found him enjoyable.
Your average popcorn movie fun and enjoyable but not a classic...

Review title: Gripping adventure with right doses of laughter!
Review_body: The trailer very much gave it all but even then the movie was hilarious. The first 10-15 minutes was a bit slow but the movie picks up pace slowly once the characters transform to their avatars. From then on, there is never a dull moment. There are times when I just can't wait for a movie to finish if the plot is not gripping enough. But not for this one. I was hooked till the end. Jack Black and Kevin Hart were awesome and funny. The ending though was a bit absurd with regard to Nick Jonas' character. Also wished GnR's Welcome to the jungle' played much more earlier in the movie. Besides that, this is definitely worth a watch on the big screen. Thumbs up!

Review title: Funny scenes at times but certain points too sexual/over explained. Some spoilers in review.
Review_body: Too many sexual references to Jack Black's private parts. Some points of movie leave audience confused, especially with all the over explaining each actor does with their assigned game character's power abilities. It seemed like overkill. Overall, with certain scenes being too slow due to the over explanations and jumping around too much (like when Joe Jonas contemplates flying. He first repeatedly says "I can't do it!" because he never used his character's power of aviation in 20 years inside game) but then after a long spiel of how he's the only one that can get them out of the current situation, he then all of a sudden has courage and says, "reporting for duty." Would have been less confusing to just say "I've never flown but let's do this." Back and forth with no's and yes's, and no I'm scared, no wait you're right I can do it, no you're the one with the power, etc. is why it felt like overkill, too many explanations and jumping around. It happened with Dwayne Johnson's character, too, when he's confronted with the snake. And, instead, Kevin Hart ends the scene a hero. Just too jumpy to fully enjoy.There's another scene where the characters find out their powers and one says "How did you do that?" Dwayne Johnson says something like, "I just touched my peck" and the red headed female character (sorry, unfamiliar with her real name) tries to touch her chest in same manner but doesn't work so Kevin Hart says something like, "Let me help, I think you need to touch higher" and she swats his hand away. Not a fan of films encouraging sexual harassment. The audience didn't laugh at most of the sexually natured scenes because they were just uncomfortable, especially with all the sexual assault allegations going on in Hollywood right now. I would not recommend to take your kids to this film, it's not kid friendly like the 1995 version. Jumpy scenes combined with the overly sexualized references to Jack Black's private parts and other sexual references, 5 stars.
By far the best comedy i have watched the last 6-7 years.

And I surprised that this movie has 7.0 score in here. totally overrated don't watch if you're a real movie fan

Review title: A fun watch for the family
Review_body: This movie contains an interesting and fun plot with characters that most kids will understand and at the very least find amusing. Dwayne Johnson's towering physique paired with Kevin Hart's towering comedic value make a great pair in this movie and keep the viewer laughing while the fast paced action keeps them on the edge of their seat. While it may not warrant watching more than once, Jumanji serves as a very entertaining and very funny adventure for the likes of a family hoping to laugh and not get bored.

Review title: About what you'd expect, but a bit more complex
Review_body: Just a disclaimer: I haven't seen the original Jumanji, so I am not sure if this changes my opinion. So, anyway, this is about what you'd expect from a Kevin Hart and the Rock movie, good, funny, kinda dumb. It's very funny, but it is simple, and doesn't give much more meaning than what is displayed directly on screen. There are quite a few good jokes that weren't spoiled by any of the trailers. It has more story than Central Intelligence, but not as many jokes. It also has more character development and more complex jokes. I honestly prefer Jumanji to Central Intelligence, merely because it is more complex than other Dwayne Johnson movies. Getting into the nitty-gritty details, the camera angles during the fight scenes are completely awful, with that whiplash-inducing cut every second mentality that seems to be becoming ever more common in Hollywood movies. The acting is good, I mean it has Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Jack Black, so how bad could it be? The writing is also pretty good as well. There was really only one joke that really grated me, as well as the fact that nothing was explained about the game itself. Being a geek myself it really frustrated me that they didn't go deeper into this anonymous video game console, but at this point I am nitpicking. I don't want to spoil anything, but the way that the game ends makes it very unlikely that there will be a remake, which in my opinion would have been cool to see.

Review title: Okay - Some funny moments but nothing interesting or new
Review_body:
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is okay. Jack Black, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Dwayne Johnson all give good performances but the script of this movie lets it down. It explained a lot to me when I discovered that the screenplay of this film is written by - wait for it - four people. A boring beginning and predictable, uninspiring ending is what can happen so easily when a film is written by a panel.
I've hardly thought about this film since I left the cinema, and I struggle to recommend it to anyone.
6/10.

I literally predicted the ending within 20 min. Everything was predictable, no surprises. As soon as the guy in the jeep said you must put the gem in the statues eye and scream jumanji. I knew immediatley the would put the gem in, and not know what to do next. Surprisingly though it was the Jack Black, played by the popular teen girl who cant get off her phone for more than a minute, who remembered to say the name. The only thing good about this movie was the CGI. Sad to see the Rock and Kevin Hart play in such a poorly directed movie.
This movie could start of with more improvements. It is a good movie for the kids because it will mature them up a bit

Review title: This is a good movie.. you'll laugh out loud
Review_body:
It's one of those movies you can watch more than once & like it more. So funny ..the cast is fantastic together ..👌😆
Kevin Hart - hilarious & the Rock & Jack Black ..all perfect in their characters in jumanji land. Love to laugh. This is one of my favs. Was on FX tonight..my 3rd time to watch it. U will LOL. Not a stupid or slap stick funny.. great story & acting ! action packed & for all ages. 👍 Pam.

I really enjoyed watching this movie. It knows what it is and what it wants to be and executes it very well. The humor actually lands and makes you laugh, and it was really fun to see all of these actors out of their type casts' (except for Kevin Hart). I remember not really liking the original as a kid because I thought it was boring, so I didn't bother to watch this until four years after it came out, and its MUCH more entertaining. It moves at a fast-pace, with the perfect balance of team-building, comedy and action. And yes, they could've gone a little deeper with some of the relationships, but you aren't here to watch that. You're here to watch a cool, action-packed adventure movie, with high stakes and entertaining dialogue and humor. The only real fault I see, is the villain who was pretty boring and just creepy and one-dimensional in my opinion, but it makes sense considering that most video game villains are one-dimensional guys, which is cool. All in all, great movie, highly recommend.

Review title: One of the funniest movies I've seen
Review_body: I absolutely loved this movie. It had me laughing through the entire film. Jack Black and Kevin Hart were hilarious. I'd highly recommended this movie if you haven't seen it.
Suuuuper cringy intro for a movie. Generic over the top bad acting teenage intro to Jumani. If you can get past it (I skipped on Netflix) it's a good movie.

Review title: Good Acting, Horrible Plot: Pretty much The Breakfast Club mixed with a "Sucked into the game" plot
Review_body: Everyone that gave this a rating above 5, either doesn't know a good movie if it hit them over the head, or they don't remember the original fondly. There are so many things wrong with this movie and it's almost nothing like the original:The setup to the movie is terrible, it's like they couldn't come up with a good way to make the video game plot happen so they were just like Alex's friend find the board on the beach and brings it home to him, he says "Psh, who plays board games anymore!" because it's 1996 and video games are all the rage, and during the night the INSIDE of the board turns into a video game. WTF? Also the game cartridge looks to be from an Atari system....isn't this supposed to be 1996? Atari came out in the 70s and 80s! Couldn't they have splurged a little and purchased a license to make a Genesis/SNES/N64 cartridge or a Playstation CD....considering that's what console he was playing?! Also where does he get this random console from? He just happened to have it laying around? The high school drama scene wasn't that bad, what was worse though was the "getting sucked into the game" bit, it was so cheesy with the whole "lets play this old video game instead of ripping staples out of magazines" and then of course sparks fly from it like it's a big computer..The rest of the movie is with the real stars, and the acting is great, which you would expect from these four. Karen Gillan looks phenomenally sexy and was pretty much the only reason why I kept watching it.Once they're in the game, almost nothing reminds you that this is a Jumanji movie, other than the fact that they keep referencing it. They get chased by guys on motorcycles and a few animals. Big whoop. Where's the hunter that was trying to kill everyone in the original? Where are the monkeys? The quicksand? The spiders? The monsoons? The tiger? I didn't care about the characters at all (once in the game), they were poorly developed and it was just a "race to the end". Whenever they were safe, the motorcycle guys appeared, couldn't they have come up with better villains? They get out of the game, and of course they're all friends now! Who would have thought?! After watching it, it totally felt like The Breakfast club mixed with a horrible 90s sucked into the video game plot.Maybe if I was a kid or a young teenager, and hadn't seen the original I would have liked it. But as a 32 year old male, who fondly remembers the original, this sucked.

The acting is not very good, the story it's nothing like the first movie which in my opinion is 3 times better then this one and that one was made with kids for kids
The new one is made with adults for teenagers considering the constant sexuality
I was really hopeful that they will keep the most interesting parts of the first movie (the nice riddles and the new treats) but the only thing they kept was the guy who started the game and was trapped for 20 years. The cgi is cheap.
I gave it a 5 that means I'm disappointed. I chucked several times but it was not enough.

Review title: Expected Trash. Laughed the entire time.
Review_body: I turned this movie on solely for the fact there was nothing else to watch. I was going to give the movie 10 minutes and turn it off. After the first couple minutes I was hooked. The humor is great and family friendly. I honestly laughed harder at this movie than I have in a long time. Overall this is a great movie to throw on alone or with a family to have a fun feel good time filled with laughs. Highly recommend especially if you were thinking this movie would not be for you.
Go and watch this jungle comedy with creative changes to the original

Jumanji is one of those movies that you must watch every single time it comes on TV. It doesn't matter how old I am, or what I'm doing, Jumanji is getting watched! Robin Williams performance in the film was phenomenal, and personally, one of my favorites. This being said, I was very weary about the new Jumanji coming out. I knew for sure thy would ruin it. No way could they compete with the modern classic!! 22 years later & all I could gather up were low expectations and mild interests.
However, given my low enthusiasm of this film, I was pleasantly surprised by how "fun" the movie is. The movie theatre actually filled with laughter (mine included). You couldn't help but smile your way through it. Given the all the components (Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, and Jack Black) comedy is sure to ensue. And let's face it...anytime Kevin & Dwayne do anything on screen together, I don't care what it is, I'm there.Unfortunately, I will say that Kevin Hart is exactly that in this movie, Kevin Hart. We all know his humor, and to be honest it is getting sort of old and routine. His comedic style is very predictable and sometimes overdone. Jack Black (Bethany) delivers a great performance with his rendition of a white teenage girl that will have you laughing the whole way through. His one-liners kept a smile on my face the whole movie, and surprisingly he became my favorite character.
Going into this movie, I had to keep reminding myself that it is not, by any means, a remake of the original. There were very scarce similarities, and I found that as an upside. I loved the fact that the film tried to stand on its own. They weren't trying to recreate and redo this classic that they could potentially ruin. Going in with an open mind really helped me enjoy this new Jumanji film. It delivers a continuation of the film with some major modern updates for the 2000 generation.
"Jumanji" (1995) was thrilling and chilling. You're lying if you say you weren't terrified of those humongous spiders or Van Pelt with his shotgun. "In the jungle you must wait, until the dice read 5 or 8" was my constant reminder to NEVER play Jumanji, even if the board game was bought at the nearest Walmart. However, "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle," was not scary or thrilling at all. It definitely is more comedic than adventurous, which depending on your preferred genre, may be a plus or negative to you.
It is definitely a great film for the family to see together right around the holidays, just don't count on any Oscar nominations any time soon 😊

When I first saw the trailer I already knew this movie was gonna be an enjoyable ride that I can watch easily with my friends. Or if you don't have friends, well guess what?! This movie is perfect still for some self-indulgence! I had no idea why some people were saying that this movie was going to bombed because it clearly won't to me at least. It has a star-studded cast who were all excellent in their respective roles. I was actually surprise to see Nick Jonas here! Haven't seen him for a while and he putted up a great act. Jumanji captures all the essence of old school video games and the 90s. Since this movie is made by Sony Pictures you will see tons of Sony games like Uncharted 3 in the kid's room. That was really cool that they put it in there being a Sony fan myself. ALL IN ALL GO OUT AND BUY A TICKET FOR THIS MOVIE NOW!!!

Review title: "THEY'RE MAKING A JUMANJI SEQUEL? HOW COULD THEY? IS NOTHING SACRED???
Review_body: That was my initial reaction when Sony announced that they were revisiting the Robin Williams led classic. "Great, another studio exploiting an irreplacable movie just for the cash." But I was pleasantly surprised by the trailer so I was curious and honestly, after watching it, this is a pretty solid movie.The basic premise is that four kids in detention (with a bit of a Breakfast Club dynamic) find an old video game called "Jumanji" and are immediately sucked into the game and have to fight their way through the jungle as their characters.They could not have picked a better cast, in my opinion. Jack Black and The Rock (whom I refuse to call by his real name) especially were able to pull off characters that were outside of their usual roles. The Rock as the archetypal nerd whose avatar is a strong, muscular adventurer, and Jack Black as the popular girl who gets stuck as an older overweight cartographer guarantee laughs. But I don't want to underplay Kevin Hart and Karen Gillans performances. Kevin Hart as the jock playing as a short zoologist and Gillan as an outcast who plays as a commando and "killer of men." I'd imagine it's difficult for an adult to convincingly play a teenager without overdoing it but luckily, this cast has it covered. Despite being comedic characters they each have an arc that balances out the more goofy moments and add heart, which I was expecting this film would lack.This accompanied by a clever script in a very video game setting, they did well portraying live action video game play complete with cut scenes and side quests nostalgic of similar styled video games from the 90s. I was also relieved that they didn't try to oversaturate it with references to the original. There was one blink-if-you-miss-it moment that was brief but satisfying.Overall this is a fun movie that makes you laugh and gives you enough adventure action to warrant the title.
Great remake! Just as good if not better than the original

I really didn't laughed this much for a long period of time. The movie was very entertaining all along. Every character played their role awesomely. I wished a bit better ending story. But, in my honest opinion, this movie is awesome and worth every moment of watching it.

Review_body: Great story. Entertaining. Love how some critics panned the movie. Made a billion dollars. Not bad for a crappy movie. Part 3 next.... hope for the same type result.

Jumanji: Welcome To The Jungle is a sequel to the 1995 original starring Robin Williams as a man who stumbles upon a magic board game that brings the elements of the game into the real world. The sequel takes a different turn to catch up with the current craze: VIDEO GAMES. The film stars Dwayne "The Rock Johnson, Kevin Hart, Karen Gillan and Jack Black as the avatars of four teenagers who were sucked into the game. If you've seen the cast or watched the trailers, you'd probably go into this film thinking its a comedy. IT'S NOT(at least not a good one). Most of the jokes in this film where already shown in the trailers, and the ones that weren't didn't really click well. But where one aspect of this film falls short, another stands tall and that is the action. The action scenes in this film are beautifully choreographed, from motorcycle chases to the dance fights the film always exceeds my expectations(it also doesn't hurt that the cast does most of their own stunts).  Speaking of the cast, they're a bit of a mixed bag. I usually love Kevin Hart but he doesn't really work in this film because of the setup with his teenage counterpart who is a confident, VERY SERIOUS, jock. Kevin Hart is basically just playing Kevin Hart which works a lot, but not here. Dwayne Johnson is lacking a lot in this film, yes he does great in action sequences, but when it comes to the serious heartfelt moments(which the film has)he doesn't deliver. Karen Gillan and Jack Black are the real stars here. Jack Black plays a great typical teenage mean girl, and Karen Gillan really proves that she can hold her ground with the big names around her. Not to mention, that she has the BEST action scenes in the film. Gamers who go and watch this film will have an especially good time with the film's nods and respect to the video game format, The NPC(non player character)gags, work really well, even with the general audience and the dramatic cutscene with the players commenting is a nice add in. The villain in this film is bad but that makes him good, most video game villains are usually handsome, one dimensional characters, who just want to destroy the world and that exactly what this villain is and why it works. The film shoots on location in Hawaii which leads to some great set pieces and makes the film more believable really amercing the audience into the world of Jumanji. The CGI in the film is also very well done for a film with a smaller budget. Surprisingly, this film has very well written screenplay which leads to some actual emotional and heartfelt moments, if only those moments were performed with real emotion and genuine acting. Sadly there not, most of these moments center around a character who has been trapped in the game for about 20 years. This character is played by Nick Jonas and it really, really does not work out well most of the film he over acts and cant even sell his comedy. Jumanji: Welcome To Jungle is one of the delightful surprises of 2017, delivering a fun "Popcorn and Soda" flick to watch with your friends and family in the theater on a holiday weekend.

If you were a fan of the original, you will definitely enjoy this. It does have references to the original. It also takes a new perspective. The original was a board game that had things coming out that the players has to interact with (unless you were sucked in). In this, the board game realises people play game consoles and adapts to it (to make it appealing to the newer age group). The players are sucked into the game (no option for things to come out - which is disappointing) as the avatars they chose and have to complete a mission with different 'levels' (which are different areas of a map). The humour is very good (jack black playing a woman in a mans body for one). The trailer doesn't show all the good bits so there's nothing to worry about there. The film is full of entertainment.

Review title: Fun to watch for all, but not the same
Review_body: My family went to see this in the theater. I was very excited as the first movie was a big hit for me and I had really enjoyed it. Because of this, I had very high hopes going into the theater.The 4 main characters are sent to detention where they find a videogame changed from a board game that sucks them into it. To get out they have to play the game as a regular video game as their avatars, and not die while doing so. Dwayne Johnson is very well known and has a lot of credit in movies, but in this one he didn't have that click that he always does, perhaps because he was playing a nerdy kid. Kevin Hart's character was funny and entertaining to keep up with, and laughs went all around the theater when he cracked jokes. But Karen Gillan and Jack Black really kept the amusement going. Karen Gillan played another nerdy character but showed extraordinary character devolpment in a hilarious way. Jack Black was a gem as usual. He played a popular teenage girl with classic high school problems, and this really clicked for me.Meanwhile, I had also hoped that there would be some ties back to the first film in 1995, but unfortunately there were not many, only a couple here and there. Something that disappointed my inside kid was the fact that this board game changed into a video game, it didn't seem very realistic and I believe there could have been a lot of success if they had kept it as a board game and been sucked into there the same way Alan Parrish was.Either way, the film was entertaining for what it was and I would recommend for all who enjoy action with a touch of comedy!

I went to see this on the day of its public release, and in honesty I didn't have high hopes, however this movie blew me away. The story wasn't the best however the character and comedic scenes of this action-adventure is what really put a smile on my face and laughter pouring out of my mouth. I was not bored for a second and the movie constantly kept you entertained with a variety of comedy. In my opinion, I enjoyed watching this movie more than the Rovbin William original. The one flaw however is the antagonist in this movie... He isn't very interesting and is.. kind of just there. But asides from that it was a joy to watch.

I would watch this movie two more times at least. This was a very funny movie. Arguably one of the best performance Jack Black has done. When I watched this with my family, in a packed movie theatre, I kid you not, the entire cinema was laughing during quite a few of the scenes. The humour is excellently tailored to the audience and is a beautiful tribute to the original Jumanji with Robin Williams. The way it fantastically coincides with the original movie and moves onto a sort of sequel to this is beautiful, and a rare thing these days. The movie is very funny and easily one of the greatest movies to have come out this year. It is certainly in the top 15 movies that have come out, post 2010, accompanied with the likes of Guardians of the Galaxy, Deadpool and now the recent movie that just came out, Bright. If you felt that Bright was also under-appreciated by movie critics, the exact same thing has happened here as Jumanji is a 100% gaurantee, a movie that will be appreciated after watching. Personally, I would watch it again and again with people. It is not just a movie to watch and discard, this is one to put on the bookshelf and watch again in the future. Loved it. Thank you for such a great movie with a fantastic and fun cast who clearly have great chemistry on and off the screen.

Review title: If in doubt put The Rock in it
Review_body:
Yep it's the return of Jumanji, but after all these years it's not an old fashioned board game, oh no, it's one of them new fangled (by 1996's standards at least) computer ones.
With our cast 'sucked' into the game its down to Amy Pond off of Doctor Who, Jack Black off of Jack Black filums (though a bit camper) and Dwayne Johnson off of the wrestler The Rock to complete the missions and save the day.
It skips along nicely with its various computer game tropes, actors playing against type, knockabout comedy and CGI wild animals.
But alas no Robin Williams5 Phils out of 10PS Expect Jumanji: Return to the Jungle sometime soonPPS Warning this film contains Baby I love Your Way by Big Mountain

Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a hilarious family movie that captures its audience through its epic tale. The movie is funny in ways that allow it to relate to most audiences. The new Jumanji follows the traditional story set in a newer setting, and instead of Jumanji being a board game, it is instead a video game. The film is set up so well that it does not feel like another copy of Jumanji, but instead its own original plot. The cast is paired so well, the movie is easy to stay interested in their hilarious connection that keeps its audience laughing. The cast accurately captures their roles as high school students from many social stances. The movie's various theatrical elements also add to the vibrant setting of the movie keeping its audience on the edge of their seats. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is all around a must-see, adventure packed story.

Jumanji 2017 is an movie that people have low expectation in because it's studio and it's Jumanji so what do you expect watching from the old ones so some people just expect it would be a remake of the old one but with better quality and maybe better cast, but they were wrong.Jumanji welcome to the forest is one of the best movies I've ever watch. It has so many aspects such as comedy, action, fantasy, adventure. The best one is its comedy the movie uses old a new joke that makes the character funny and the cast fits the character very well like the main character is casted by Dwayne Johnson which is considered one of the best comedy actors while in some movies that he cast are comedy and action. Every gesture, every note from The Rock, Kevin Hart and Jack Black are perfection they're no negativity in the movie which make the main casts very comfortable in each of their role. Not to mention it does not abandon its traditional Jumanji movie from the 90s a classic game that turns into reality people who goes into the game. Jumanji welcome to the forest also has a very great story and plot the movie has many plot twist and amazing quality for a movie in 2017 the side character and villain in Jumanji also makes it like a live adventure which refreshes the viewer's mind. There is no boring moment in the movie and the cast very knows they're own character which make it very lively. Although the movie is great in its own element for some people, they need drama which is the most lacking one here although in some cases they are some but most of them are covered by its comedy aspect.Best comedy, action movie.

Review title: A disappointing sequel to the 1995 original that fell short of expectations.
Review_body: If you were looking at this movie because it stars Dwayne Johnson and you wanted an easy-going movie to watch that would give you some laughs along the way, then Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is probably for you. However, as someone who was hoping for more than what felt like a re-heated and poorly executed sequel to Joe Johnston's 1995 original Jumanji, I was left sorely disappointed.The movie starts off as you'd expect, you have some high-school kids who stumble upon the Jumanji board-game, and curiosity gets the better of them and they decide to play the game. Anyway, here's where I was hoping things would get more interesting - as director Jake Kasden took the really intriguing decision to actually set the game inside of the Jumanji universe this time, rather than the game just taking place in the real-world as the character rolls the dice. This was where I was left most disappointed, because I felt that with the setting of the Jungle, this provided so much room for creative license and all-new interpretations for how the game could play out, and yet this is where Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle falls far short of my expectations. Despite the gripping setting and endless potential, the movie failed to hook me in as I thought it would, and for the first hour or so I found myself rather bored, yet at the same time amazed, thinking that surely it's got to get better at some point.That's not to say the movie fails in all aspects, as far as humour goes there were several moments in the story where I did find myself laughing, as the Director clearly has taken the decision not to have the story take itself too seriously. My immersion was taken away from the game because I didn't feel that the risks to the characters were as great as they were in the original movie, and I feel as though the movie strays too far in the direction of humour and inventing new elements to the game that just feel as though they do not fit with how the original Director, Joe Johnston, interpreted the game. For example, the characters all have lives, which was a surprise to me at first, but I was interested to see whether they would be executed in an interesting way or just feel like an unnecessary addition to the game. Unfortunately it ended up being the latter, as in my view they added nothing of interest to the story, and if anything just made the game even less immersive - whereas I felt the 1995 original was at least somewhat more immersive, and you felt as though the risks to those playing the game were real.In addition, the characters in Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle I felt were just too uninteresting, as you have the stereotypical nerdy college kid who falls in love with a shy girl, and then you're just spending the rest of the movie knowing exactly what's going to happen in the final scene. This would be fine if I found the characters interesting, but I just don't. The romance element just feels really tacked on in the sequel, and considering this plotline of the protagonist falling in love with the girl he is playing the game with is in the original, I was hoping that they would do something different for the sequel.Anyway, I'll wrap this up now because I'd prefer my reviews to be succint and to the point. Did I have a bad time watching this movie? No, I wouldn't say that. I still enjoyed parts of it, the humour was overall pretty good, apart from where it could feel tacked on and out of place. My biggest disappointment was the wasted potential with this movie being made over 20 years after the original Jumanji, it just felt as though the Director was more focused on the dynamic between the characters and making the audience laugh than creating a new and exciting interpretation of Jumanji, leaving me feeling bored at several points during the movie. Hopefully the 2019 sequel is better!

Review title: Good fun, if a little forgettable
Review_body: This is my first review on here. Now normally people reserve their first review to make sweeping negative statements on films they've just seen, or to rave about something while it's still fresh in their head and they're still full of that post-cinema buzz.This review is neither, and is more for me to make some honest remarks about a film I enjoyed, but later found it to have to unnecessary criticisms on these pages.I am no "critique" and when I go to see such films, I appreciate that a little bit of your brain should be switched off in order to just enjoy these films for what they are. You shouldn't be expecting Oscar performances, or epic twists etc. if you are expecting that, you shouldn't waste your time with these types of films. Why go see this film at all if that is your mindset? You do kind of know what you're getting yourself in to right?Secondly, while this film shares it's name with the original, I wouldn't put it down as a remake, rather, it's much more of a modern interpretation/adaptation. So I wouldn't really compare the old and new films directly - although people will continue to do so.So with the above in mind, this IS a good fun, action/comedy film that I think all of the family would enjoy. What I will say is that some of the humour was a bit flat and forgetful and that the general pacing was too fast. The way each character discovered their abilities for example was lame and really felt like it hadn't been given much thought. Considering this was, for myself at least, one of the main attractions of a modern Jumanji made out to be like a video game, this was a massive opportunity wasted and would have really clicked with the more nerdy members of the audience, such as myself, had they just given this area more thought. The ending was a bit cheesy, even for the cheesiest of folk, although I have to admit it did give me that happy warm feeling you sometimes get, so I won't complain too much.If you want a classic 2 hours of popcorn busting fun which doesn't have to be taken seriously at all - go and give it a watch.

Fresh out of the Star Wars film, I went to watch this film having 0 expectations, and boy, did it entertain! It was funny, exciting and overall a good time in the cinema. The cast did a good job, with Jack Black being the highlight as teen chick trapped in an obese, middle-aged man. The whole videogame aspect of the film was something that seemed rather unique to the film (it could be that I've not seen enough films based on video games)
I personally thought Kevin Hart is as annoying as he is, but the bits involving him blurting out useless information on the animals were funny (and the scene in the market was Hilarious). And the villain was just, well, there. He doesn't do much, he says something about a stone and then vanishes in the end. I found him a little useless, and it could've been reworked.
Overall, I had a fun time in the cinemas with this, it excited me, made me burst out laughing. Would definitely recommend!

The graphics are the only appealing thing about it. Get new ideas, Hollywood! And get some fresh faces on the screen!

Review title: The Jumanji movie you did not know you need
Review_body: When the first trailer came out for this movie I was immediately upset. I was worried that this movie was gonna completely destroy the beloved Robin Williams that I grew up watching. I have been proven wrong. This movie is amazing. This is Kevin Hart's best movie yet and Jack Black's best movie since School of Rock. The movie combines intense fast pace action with gut busting comedy. The scene when Kevin Hart's character eats cake, which is his weakness, and then explodes had me throwing a laughing fit in the theater. The names of the characters are also amazing. Jack Black is the curvy genius, The Rock is Dr. Smolder Bravestone which is basically who The Rock is in all of his movies. The music in this movie is absolutely phenomenal. When you hear those drums banging you know 2 things. The first is that you are scared because you have no idea what is going to happen. The second is that the characters are progressing the story of the game. As an avid gamer myself I felt that all of the actual video game bits were very well done. The non playable characters in the movie such as Nigel react just as you would expect. They only have a certain amount of lines they can say so the characters can not talk themselves out of anything they need to properly play the game and use their abilities. The action was riveting with The Rock having such superhuman strength. That is why this movie really shined for me. The roles each actor had. The scared nerdy kid becomes the most unstoppable man that has nothing to fear in The Rock. The big athlete becomes the small and weak looking Kevin Hart. The shy and to her self girl becomes the sexy man killer in Karen Gillan. The looks obsessed teenage girl becomes the overweight Jack Black. Which by the way was my favorite part of the movie. Jack Black playing a stereotypical teenage white girl had me in stitches every time he did or said anything. The scene when the teenage girl has to pee in the body of Jack Black was a non stop laugh riot the entire time. I found that every prediction I made for this movie was wrong. This movie is astounding.The only down side of this film is when they are not in the game. It makes up less than 30 minutes of screen time probably but it is a little boring. Then after the kids get out of the game their lives are better and the scenes are a lot more enjoyable since we now know these characters a lot better.

Review title: awful movie dull humor and all over the place
Review_body: Have been a big fan of Jumanji, who did not just have a pivotal role played by Robin Williams but had a fantastic supporting cast; and perhaps the best aspect was in its simplicity of screenplay in which the metaphysical twined with their existence and how wilderness and its creatures invade urban lives.The 2017 remake however chose to bring urban bike gangsters into a jungle adventure and not even the wit and charm of Dwayne Johnson could install life into the movie. The movie had a terrible screenplay, an awful stereotypical cast of characters and found the humor in the movie to be borderline offensive and racist. 3D effects are totally wasted in the movie. Would not recommend to anyone.
I can imagine like 1000 movies just like this. Sometimes some obstacles are so easy that didn't look that hard. I just watch this movie because of Nick Jonas lol .
Jumanji is by far the BEST & FUNNIEST movie I have ever seen. I highly recommend everyone watches it.

My family, we have 5 boys, loved this movie! My boys are 2 -14. I think everyone did a great job. Even the Rock playing a teenage boy did decent. It was funny and I loved that it tied it in with the old one. In my opinion it is a kids movie for sure, except the cussing, and I'm glad because I like when I can watch movies with my boys.
Everything was great even the storyline just loved to see a classic reboot

Review title: Am i the only one who is not excited about the movie??
Review_body: Previous Jumanji was a good movie for my childhood, but this one could be good for our childrens wasting their own time and having fun, but talk about this movie as an adult person this is not something i wanna watch. there is a lot of cliches in whole movie. i'm gonna talk about some of those real problems of movie:-First of all, i don't know about the relation between four characters in game and four kids in real life. is that a cliche or naturally happened because every kid wants to be someone new? but the kids character itself is 100% cliche to me.-The way that a board game turn to video game, to me was the shocking moment that we should decide to waste our time on movie or do something better. i'm talking about an irrational first plot of a movie that is not explained anywhere.-Freak house and freak old-man in the beginning cliche, it wasn't necessary to be in that way because it's not a horror movie. i hate this cliche even in horror movies-Four character, each have three life, 8 allowed death, lets kill one them to show the life span. cliche to me :)-The one eye villain lord who kills his own high-ranked staffs, cliche-Running away from those funny villains and jump off the cliff, cliche-Why movie director shows the city of bazaar in side of a mountain but later characters running in flat lands? its like they had either no vision of Jumanji map or no other city to film it. oh GUSH... its a real movie sin, that nobody noticed.-Did you noticed costume of people in bazaar?? there was intense irrelevantation. they had no idea what to do, so they mixed everything they got.-Entrance of a new character using smoke grenades 1 sec before main characters dies(plus facing villain lord in this very moment), cliche-How Alex knows about those traps in that vault?? no-way to spend his life to find out this. i can't get it. also i have a question about how those traps trigger?-the disappeared boy for 20 years has been found, cliche(you should take a look at previous Jumanji)+Bethany flirt training and Martha flirting with those guys, was the only scense that i liked during the movie-villain guys shows themselves everywhere main characters is about to leave, cliche. it repeated so much in this movie-why someone should explain CPR to someone when somebody is about to die?? why not doing that himself?? this is insane way to teach CPR... , if director wants Bethany to donate her life, he shall try another way...+Kevin Hart and Dwayne Johnson role plays are real good to me(something between cliche and classic)i wanted to give this movie 5 Star, that's what the movie deserve. but under this circumstances i'll give 2 Star to bring balance to it's Score.

Review title: Must have watched the first movie 10+ times as a kid
Review_body: I can't believe how much fun this movie was! Jack Black was incredible! So was everyone else. I could write a whole page on how much I love this movie. I had to come on here to express that I loved every minute of it. Opening pulled me in and the rest of the movie was non-stop laughs! I was just swept away by this film. Sound work was perfect. GFX were .. 'just right' considering the nature of the movie. Kevin Hart and D'TR'J are the new power comedy-duo after C.I and this. JB I feel is Legendary at everything he does at this point. Karen Gillan, say what you will to me, I was on the fence about, until this movie. She's great. Everyone was great. What a fun time! Rock solid performances from everyone all around! Im gonna stop writing and watch it again!

Review_body:

A waste of my time and money. I should've trusted my instincts about the trailer and clips to not to set foot in the cinema watching this crap. Unfunny recycled jokes, lame story and kindergarten level villain. Jumanji suppose to be exciting, emotional, funny and a little scary, but this movie failed to achieve none of it. The screenwriters probably wrote the script in the bathroom on toilet paper and forgot to wipe with it their ass. Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart are from now on my official kryptonite. Arnold S. had more charisma than both of them together. Even Jack Black who I dig, gave a goosebumps level performance.Robin Williams is probably turning in his grave.

I decided to watch this movie after watching the original Jumanji of 1995. I do understand that as this movie was released in 2017, they had to make some changes to adapt the plot to society nowadays. That is how the board game turned into a video game, and that's ok. They need to do this to make it more understandable for modern society. Nevertheless, what I hate the most is that they missed important details in the plot, and I mean VERY IMPORTANT ones.
First, in the original one, Alan realizes that he has been inside the game for years and years. He even miss track of time. Although in this movie, Alex (Alex... Alan... Alex... Alan...), has no idea that he spent twenty years in the jungle. He only thinks that he has been a couple of months.
Second, having in mind the original movie, if the game starts in 1996, once it finishes, life should continue from 1996. This means that no alternate future was created. In the original movie Alan and Sarah return to their lives, and do live until they are adult and then they meet Peter and Judy. HOWEVER, Peter and Judy do not know them because there was NO ALTERNATE FUTURE CREATED! So why do Spencer, etc, etc, remember Alex? Just because the scriptwriters made a huge mistake!
And third... why would you end the movie by destroying the game? The stupidest ending ever!
I was really disappointed! I will stay with the original one.
If you want to have nice and funny night watch Jumanji

This was such a fun film to watch as it was just constantly amusing and enjoyable. It wasn't a film that was trying to hard to be funny, as I think the actors played their roles really well and can't think of anyone else who could have played them better.
The unlikely group thrown together in chaos, create a heroic group of teens. Which I think also creates a lot of meaningful moments at the same time as it being amusing as they learn to over come hurdles in the jungle that they are able to relate to In the real world.This is definitely a comedic film that you shouldn't watch if you naturally pick films apart, as it really is a film I would put on to smile.

I took my 10yo son and his friends to see this movie long after it opened and have to say it was a ton of fun. I expected a regurgitated rendition of Robin William's adventure but this was a character driven movie about realizing who you are and who you want to be. We all laughed out loud, jumped in surprise a few times and left the theatre feeling happy. What more can you ask for in a comedy? I am not sure of it's PG13 rating, being that I was there with other people's children I tried to be very aware of situational issues, language etc. and beyond a few jokes about male genetalia, it was relatively tame. Kevin Hart was awesome, the whole cast was awesome and the tiny nod to Alan Parish from the first movie was sweet. Very well done guys.

Review title: Totally Fun and Enjoyable for Family Movie
Review_body: I went to watch Jumanji bringing my parents (who watched 1995 Jumanji), they expected just remastered remake or something, but this is totally fresh remake, and entertaining at its best as light-adventure movie.Although the school story quite cheesy, but the main plot in game is really entertaining even it's predictable (but i think they don't expect the audience for not-predict anything at all, do they?)To combine dwayne johnson, kevin hart,jack black and karen gillan in one screenplay just make this movie totally light and fun!

I really did try given the success of the first film - I gave it at least half an hour but then lost the will to live deciding that it was probably going to end up as the worst film I had ever seen! Maybe the rest of it turned into Gladiator/Ben Hur/Godfather/Butch Cassidy ... but I doubt it. Maybe Americans like that sort of thing, who knows? There's a lot to like about this film. The cast are largely playing against type; the interplay between the characters is fun; the set pieces are inventive and silly. However, this movie is predictable with a very linear plot and only moments of jeopardy for the characters. Any situation they find themselves in, they immediately dig themselves out of, and we kind of know what's going to happen before they do.The introduction to the real-life version of the characters, before the Jumanji-world scenes is long and drawn out, most likely a misguided attempt to make us appreciate the resolution of their character journeys, which is predictable and superficial.It's hard to know who this is really aimed at, with a blend of teen humour and simplistic kids' movie action.That said, it romps along, has plenty of action and CGI that looks like CGI, but you don't really care, and gives a modern twist to the original Jumanji concept.

I went to see this movie without watching the first one or having any expectations at all. I was pleasantly surprised. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a great mixture or funny jokes, nice actions scenes, great acting and interesting characters. The humor was just what it needed to be, and so was the action - not too much, not too little. It's definetely very well balanced and worth watching.

I went to this movie expecting nothing but a cheap remake of the old classic. I gotta say, i was really positively surprised. The actors were great, it had a lot jokes and the plot was also great. I loved the original. My kids loved the original. (Ages at the time of this review range from 10-16) We also really loved this one. It didn't try to be anything it wasn't. It didn't feel like a sequel trying too hard. It felt like a... part of the Jumanji franchise but not a Part 2. Action packed, fun cast, funny plot, lots of laughs - just enjoyable. We liked it so much, we bought the dvd release. We rarely buy DVD's. It is sitting next to our little family stash of feel good funny movies that we rewatch and quote to one another randomly.

This movie was really bad. Jack Black.. after all the creative stuff he's done... in basically a second episode of Mysterious Island.. this movie was just awful. Why is he in this movie.. And why did the movie keep going and going for so long -- over two hours I think???I really have to think twice before I just Rotten Tomatoes or other sites these days. No way that this thing got an audience 90. A bunch of 7-10 year old boys at the movie loved it.. outside of that.... ouch. And in the movie .. this is very awkward... The Rock who is 45 has a scene sloppily kissing an actress playing a 15 year old, Was this directed Polanski or Kevin Spacey? And.. it gets worse.. Jack Black .. hits on a teenage boy as if he was a teenage girl and makes a reference to sprouting wood over the teen boy.. I swear this is true.. Very Very Very unsettling no matter how the story line tries to makes it okay for a 45 year old to be making out with a girl playing a 15 year old.. Am I wrong???So.. what more can I say.. It was just a weird film. Not something I'd recommend.
The movie is averege but i felt embarrassed and uncomfortable after watching this with family. Jokes about private parts is unwarranted and spoils the otherwise okay movie.
I loved this movie, so epic ! you guys must watch it !

I came to this movie expecting it to be ok I knew it's a reboot so it's gonna be bad, but it has a good cast so maybe it'll be alright. I was very pleasantly surprised. Not only is it funny and exciting throughout but also the comedy and story are directly related. All the teens are changed to have bodies and skills that are the exact opposite of theirs, not only for comedic purposes but also to help each of them overcome their weaknesses. Many have complained that the story was incredibly cliche and that the whole story can be summed up by "kids get sucked in, fight,and get out", but thats not what this is about at all. This movie is first and foremost about the teens themselves (even though they have very little screen time). I'd like to say that my screening was filled with teens adults and much older people, and they were all laughing. This movie isn't neccesarily new or fresh but its a good fun movie. If you didn't enjoy this movie it's because you couldn't, cause you didn't let yourself enjoy it. To sum up I've seen 2 movies this week, this and the highly anticipated star wars: the last jedi....jumanji was better!

This movie turned out to be much better than I thought it would be, I totally expected it to be a flop. But it was actually pretty good, not too 'trying to be hip', not too sappy, but still with meaningful moments. That being said, my expectations were pretty low; if I'd gone in wanting to see the movie and expecting it to be good, I probably would have been like 'meh'. Surprisingly, (at least for me), Jack Black MADE the movie. They must have had the kids act out the scenes and then the adults recreate their expressions and mannerisms and what not, because Jack Black NAILED the teenage girl thing (and I'm a 19 y/o female). He wasn't over-the-top or stereotypical & demeaning, just super funny and spot on, and both my teenage sisters agree. All in all, not a bad movie, would definitely watch again.

This movie contained all the elements to a fantastic action/comedy movie. I knew before watching it that this movie wasn't a sequel to the original Jumanji and it prepared me with a different mindset while watching it. 
The duo of Kevin Hart and The Rock are hilarious but I didn't expect Jack Black to be so funny. Each character brought different kinds of laughs throughout the entire movie that you can relate to someway.
It is good, clean humor for adults and older teens. My fiance and I definitely buying it when it comes out on DVD. Great movie!

Do not get me wrong, This movie was done fantastically whether it was with the special effects, the character development, soundtrack or to the hilarious comedy. I personally just felt that there wasn't any intense moments that made you jump out of your seat, or compassionate moments that made you smile. I understand the route they went, but it was too focused on comedy, and quite a lot of unrealistic things. In Jumanji 1995, the scene with the lion, I was scared, almost as scared as the children, but in this Jumanji, not once did I not feel that they wouldn't make finish the journey, not once did I feel as though they should be scared. It had to switch every good or romantic or even thriller moments into something funny. The story was lighthearted and not intense enough, the script needed improvement but everything else was great. I recommend this movie if you just want to have a good time and enjoy the company of your friends and family. So through everything like this I give this movie a 6/10.

Personally I would not call this a new Jumaji film. It does not fit in with the original at all, and does not continue the story.I was very young when I first saw the original Jumanji (with Robin Williams) which I honestly felt was quite terrifying (in a good way). So, to make this comparison fair, I decided to watch both movies back to back.I can honestly say that the original grips me into the film more. HOWEVER, both Kevin Hart and Jack Black are absolutely incredible in this new film. I actually laughed out loud (too informal to say lol) at some of the jokes. I would however say that the only reason that this was called "Jumanji" was to increase profits by producing an all awaited for 'sequel'.I would highly recommend watching this film with the family, but do not expect anything linking back to the original.

Review title: Mediocre movie not worth seeing more than once.
Review_body: Not as funny and interesting as the original movie, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle delivers good visuals, and superb performance by Jack Black. Nice to have the 2nd part after 22 years though,but definitely 1st part was better in all aspect. That doesn't mean you miss this part. Go ahead and watch in IMAX 3D.

Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart were hilarious but Jack Black acting as a teenage girl giving Karen Gillan's character flirting advice was priceless!
So Funny. Very entertaining. I love Kevin Hart in this movie

Review title: If you have nothing better to do, why not?
Review_body: Look I'll put this plainly, I saw this as a 19 year old male going to the cinema with his mum because she was complaining about not spending enough time with me. This is the only reason why, I have seen the original as well as the space themed rip-off Zathura, and this was the second worst (you can imagine which was the worst, begins with a Z and ends with suicidal thoughts). It was a largely depressing experience, it was painfully predictable and the slapstick humor was right out of an episode of Tom and Jerry. Jack Black brought the crude element to this which managed to force a few laughs out of me (the reason why this film made it to a 4).Watching Dwayne Johnson neck on with Karen Gillan (this was too predictable for anyone to consider it a spoiler) made my sick in my lap and hopefully some went in my mum's popcorn.As for the Rock and Kev combo we are seeing lately is overrated, and actually it should be left there because it doesn't deserve anymore thought. If you have some sort of pay monthly and see as many films as you want membership then please go and see this as you clearly have a lot of time on your hands. For those of us who only have one life, watch almost literally anything else.

I went to see this movie with my friends for his birthday and we really enjoyed it. Overall, we were entertained throughout the entire movie. The plot and acting were equally entertaining. It was a good movie.

This was so well done and did not even "betray" Robin Williams as some people might think. Great acting, lots of laughs and different enough from the original that the word "remake" does not even apply to this. The only things in common are the name of the game, a video game becomes reality, it involves a jungle and it has to be played to the end. How could you go wrong with Kevin Hart, Jack Black and The Rock? 
Loved this movie.
Like This Movie Because This Movie Really Very Good
Plain great. A little over-action, but Rock rocks in the movie.The video game storyline did good.

Review_body: I watched this movie and get a lot of enjoy. Specially Nick Jonas played a very interesting role with adventurer, traveler. He looks great in distressed leather jacket.

When I first saw the first trailer for this movie, I was very skeptic. Being a big fan of the Original Jumanji film, I was very disappointing that they were making a sequel that no one asked for, and that somehow the Jumanji board game turned into a video game.Now seeing the film I have learned that we should be less judgmental about the trailer of a film because there is always a chance of a bad trailer turning into a good film. Even though I almost can't believe that the Jumanji board game was just able to turn into a video game, for some reason watching the film, I just let it slide, because when it does turn into a video game, they handle everything so well that even though I still don't know how to explain how a board game turned into a video game, I was glad that it turned into a video game. The environment was really cool when they got sucked into the game, the cast was also really great, especially the actors playing the video game characters, because they had to play video game characters but have the personality of there teenager selves. Like Jack Black who was a popular girl in High School, but in the video game she is middle-aged fat man (which is one of the funniest parts of the movie). The comedy was also very great, the special effects, everything! I really enjoyed this movie and I regret hating on it when the trailers were out.In the end, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a great film, with a great cast, great environment, cool plot, nice special effects, and many more. I recommend seeing it yourself, with your friends too if you wanted to. I give this movie an 8/10.

Review title: Great choice for a family movie - surprisingly funny!
Review_body: Our kids are ages 8 and 9 and we rarely go to movies because it's hard to find kids movies that are tolerable to sit through. When I saw the trailer, i thought we'd give it a try as my kids love video games. I wasn't expecting much but it was hilarious! I thoroughly enjoyed the movie from beginning to end and the kids said it was the funniest movie they'd ever seen. The Rock was great and the role of Jack Black playing a self-absorbed teenage girl was really funny.
Technically well done movie, funny cast, but the story is random and boring af.

The movie is fantastic i enjoyed it very much.... The actors are acting very funny and Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart are best actors in movie. overall the movie is comic and for anyone can watch... the age rating is not specified for this movie cause this movie is actually awesome. I can recommend for everyone and want to watch again.

Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a movie worth watching because of the humor, action, and actors. I recently watched this movie with my friends at Ward Theatre, which was filled with not only children and high school students, but with adults as well. The film stars Dwayne Johnson as Dr. Smolder, Jack Black as Professor Sheldon, Kevin Hart as Moose Finbar, Karen Gillan as Ruby Roundhouse, Nick Jonas as Alex, and Bobby Cannavale. The summary of this movie is that four high school students get trapped in a video game, Jumanji, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game. The students are Spencer Gilpin, Bethany Walker, Martha Kaply, and Anthony Johnson. When they pick their avatars for the game, their characters are completely opposite of who they are. Bethany, a self absorbed instagram girl becomes an overweight male cartographer, Anthony, a tall basketball star becomes a short zoologist, Spencer, a lanky school boy becomes Dwayne Johnson, a muscular adventurer, and Martha, a shy conservative girl becomes a gorgeous martial arts expert. These changes in their true character unlocks an opportunity for humor. As the movie unfolds, the students learn their "special talents" and weaknesses. Through trial and error, they discover that they each have only three lives. If they lose all three, they die in real life. The purpose of the game is to obtain the stone, return it to the jaguar statue, and shout, "Jumanji". The humor in this movie continues through each scene, even if is an action, serious, or sentimental moment. The humor is also purely innocent and does not get boring at the end. This movie is definitely for people of all ages, and it is a good movie to watch if you just want a good laugh. The action parts are entertaining and the addition of humor make it even better. Assuming they make it out of Jumanji alive, the characters become friends in real life. They take this adventure with them, and it is something that they all share with each other. Spencer, Martha, Bethany, and Anthony are four people who never would have been friends if it was not for this game. They all learn a lot about themselves from this experience and they find a new appreciation for their real life. By pretending to be someone else in the game, their confidence in their actual life grows. I highly recommend this movie to people of all ages because of the humor, action, and actors, and I would definitely watch it again.Although I believe that Jumanji is definitely a must see movie, not everyone has the same opinion. Critics argue that Jumanji is not funny and that it is only amusing for younger children. They claim that the humor gets boring towards the end, but, to me, it does not. Kevin Hart plays a great role in this movie, and he really ties the movie together to make it entertaining. People may not have enjoyed this humor because it is simply not the type of humor they like. It is all opinionated and depends on the viewer. Furthermore, this innocent humor reaches more viewers than other types of humor because it is appropriate for everyone. It is a good movie to watch with family and friends, and it is the type of movie one would watch simply to have a good time. Critics also argue that Jumanji is not like the original movie. Although this is true, the purpose of this second Jumanji is to not make it similar to the original, but to make it different and even better. It is not meant to repeat a film that was already made because it would not be different. Watchers would already know what would happen, and the only difference would be different actors. This new Jumanji was creative and out of the box. Unlike the previous Jumanji movies that were scary and very serious, this one took a spin that turned Jumanji into a video game rather than a board game. It was also more humorous than serious and more enjoyable to watch. This comedic film far surpasses the other Jumanji movies because of both the humor, actio, and actors. Contrary to critic's arguments, Jumanji is definitely a worthwhile film that I highly recommend. The humor, action, and famous actors are all factors that made Jumanji the great movie that it is.

I saw the previous Jumanji (95) and it was always dearest to my heart. I was REALLY skeptical in watching this one. It looked like they were going to ruin the first one and make it more commercial. At the end of the day that is exactly what they did! But I did not expect it would be so but so much fun to watch! Could barely stop laughing!
Enjoyed it <3

I feel wasting my time for this film. I don't get any funny with the content or any dialogues

Was wondering how a sequel would fare to this unusual original, but they did a great job. great cast complimented the script well. Good humor stuck in perfect places, good action. Everything seemed to flow very well and the cast gelled together like few others. Enjoyed watching this from front to back and not any real dull moments where a viewer would just sigh and hit the "stop" button or fast forward. Well done :)

I figured the first one could not be touched, but ten minutes in, I realized it's a totally different movie, with only the basic premise intact, which turned out not to be a bad thing. I see all these terrible reviews (about half) and can't help but wonder what those people were expecting. Seems like a bunch of hoity-toities who probably should go watch Titanic some more and stop trying to ruin the fun for would-be viewers.This movie had me laughing pretty hard. Those who said "stereotypical characters" obviously missed the point. Jack Black and Dwayne Johnson stole the show early on and everyone else rocked it as well.I can't help think but the ones who left poor reviews either don't like comedy or maybe don't enjoy the cast, which blows my mind. Maybe there was a little to be desired from the story, but it seems mainly for a younger audience, so...
Take it for what it is and try not to take it too seriously: IT IS A COMEDY, and it is very silly.I like the video game implementations and yes, that made it a little predictable, but didn't steal anything away from the possible enjoyment.
Killer movie. Not to be compared to the original movie, which seemed more aimed for kids, where this new version/sequel (?) was more aimed for comedy. I loved it.

Review title: You're Going to Need a SEATBELT
Review_body:
I used to have an IMDB account when I was a teen - or at least thought I did, but couldn't log on. In any case, I think I've visited here maybe twice in the last five years. Today though, after just getting back from watching this with my almost-grown kids, I had to make an account just to leave this review.To begin, I'll never understand people. I can't believe the negative reviews. How could anyone not have laughed like hell while watching this and still have a pulse? I didn't go in expecting much, but I came out with a smile on my face. The girl is hot, Jack Black "owns it", I've never been overly enthused about Kevin Hart, but he was fantastic. and The Rock just knocked it out of the park. I saw one review which reads: "not a wrestling fan ever so to see 'the rock' in movies, instantly puts me off!" Does anyone else want to vomit at the inanity, irony and ludicrousness of that statement? Then you have the user who out of 40+ titles he/she has reviewed in the past has only ever rated TWO above three stars. Seriously, if you don't enjoy films and find them so terrible, find a new hobby already. You've got one guy saying the shirt one of the kids wore was outdated. So, I'm guessing one can only wear clothing depicting the current year? Then you have the reviewers who maybe didn't understand the dialogue since they can barely communicate correctly themselves (such gems - I kid you not - as: 'averege'; 'what so ever'; 'family fair' (fare); 'are just wasn't'; 'due to it has'; 'all of there' {their); 'coz it is boring story'; 'no compare with'). Finally, you have the maybe half dozen reviewers who are so caught up in their bigotry that they can't relax and enjoy a film if it isn't whitewashed and who complain about the "Hollywood liberal agenda of diversity". Leave the politics at the door, man.
In short, Jumanji Welcome to the Jungle was a fantastic hour or more of rip-riding fun and laughs.Except for one very funny moment, Dwayne Johnson retires his wrestling persona for this film and instead, provides a smoldering and intense performance, riddled with good-natured hilarity as the lead in this film. Gillan was great in Doctor Who, and although I thought she was the weakest of both characters and actors in this film, she still held her own and looked fantastic doing so. She has one of those faces you can't help but love. Kevin Hart was fantastic as the diminutive valet and looking back, I think he was somehow involved in every funny moment in which I laughed the hardest. Finally, the master, the maestro (though I never really was a fan prior to this), Jack Black plays the teen beauty queen with 100% commitment and to perfection.10/10 and definitely a film I will be purchasing right after I click "Submit". You can never have enough laughter in life, and Jumanji, Welcome to the Jungle delivers barrels-full.
It look like a parodie...I'm very disappointed, i had good hope for this movie!

Review title: The definition of Cliché and Cheese
Review_body: The main problem here is that the film is filled with typical cheesy lines, as well as predictable plot lines. This essentially wastes the comedic talents of Kevin Hart and Jack Black, and Karen Gillan's character is far from the flippant and sassy character of Amy Pond that people tend to expect. What we end up getting is just run of the mill characters with no depth, acting as stand-ins. Anyways, the plot line seems to be forced (the tension between Spencer and Fridge seems to have arisen out of nowhere, same w the affection between Spencer and Martha). Ironic that a movie with a video game theme has a worse storyline than games such as WoW or Starcraft.
Probably the worst movie I've ever seen in my entire life.

Review_body: I thought the humor was the greatest. Jack Black probably stole the show with his portrayal of a teenage girl. He was so much fun! Of course, it was way off the original movie, but that honestly doesn't bother me when a movie is done well.
